name: duplicator
description: The duplicator library allows you to specify what should be saved when someone attempts to duplicate your custom entity with the duplicator tool. It can also be used by 3rd party duplicator tools to make use of the built in system.

functions.name: Allow
functions.description: Allow this entity to be duplicated

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: An entity's classname

functions.name: ApplyBoneModifiers
functions.description: Calls every function registered with <page>duplicator.RegisterBoneModifier</page> on each bone the ent has.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player whose entity this is

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity in question

functions.name: ApplyEntityModifiers
functions.description: Calls every function registered with <page>duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier</page> on the entity.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player whose entity this is

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity in question

functions.name: ClearEntityModifier
functions.description: Clears/removes the chosen entity modifier from the entity.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity the modification is stored on

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key of the stored entity modifier

functions.name: Copy
functions.description: Copies the entity, and all of its constraints and entities, then returns them in a table.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to duplicate. The function will automatically copy all constrained entities.

arguments.name: tableToAdd
arguments.description:
A preexisting table to add entities and constraints in from.
Uses the same table format as the table returned from this function.

returnValues.description:
A table containing duplication info which includes the following members:
* <page>table</page> Entities
* <page>table</page> Constraints
* <page>Vector</page> Mins
* <page>Vector</page> Maxs

The values of Mins & Maxs from the table are returned from <page>duplicator.WorkoutSize</page>

functions.name: CopyEnts
functions.description: Copies the passed table of entities to save for later.

arguments.name: ents
arguments.description: A table of entities to save/copy.

returnValues.description:
A table containing duplication info which includes the following members:
* <page>table</page> Entities
* <page>table</page> Constraints
* <page>Vector</page> Mins
* <page>Vector</page> Maxs

functions.name: CopyEntTable
functions.description: Returns a table with some entity data that can be used to create a new entity with <page>duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable</page>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity table to save

functions.name: CreateConstraintFromTable
functions.description: <internal></internal> Creates a constraint from a saved/copied constraint table.

arguments.name: constraint
arguments.description: Saved/copied constraint table

arguments.name: entityList
arguments.description: The list of entities that are to be constrained

functions.name: CreateEntityFromTable
functions.description:
"Create an entity from a table."


This creates an entity using the data in EntTable.


If an entity factory has been registered for the entity's Class, it will be called.


Otherwise, <page>duplicator.GenericDuplicatorFunction</page> will be called instead.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player who wants to create something

arguments.name: entTable
arguments.description: The duplication data to build the entity with. See <page>Structures/EntityCopyData</page>

functions.name: DoBoneManipulator
functions.description:
"Restores the bone's data."


Loops through Bones and calls <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneScale</page>, <page>Entity:ManipulateBoneAngles</page> and <page>Entity:ManipulateBonePosition</page> on ent with the table keys and the subtable values s, a and p respectively.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to be bone manipulated

arguments.name: bones
arguments.description: Table with a <page>Structures/BoneManipulationData</page> for every bone (that has manipulations applied) using the bone ID as the table index.

functions.name: DoFlex
functions.description: Restores the flex data using <page>Entity:SetFlexWeight</page> and <page>Entity:SetFlexScale</page>

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to restore the flexes on

arguments.name: flex
arguments.description: The flexes to restore

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: The flex scale to apply. (Flex scale is unchanged if omitted)

functions.name: DoGeneric
functions.description:
"Applies generic every-day entity stuff for ent from table data."


Depending on the values of Model, Angle, Pos, Skin, Flex, Bonemanip, ModelScale, ColGroup, Name, and BodyG (<page>table</page> of multiple values) in the data table, this calls <page>Entity:SetModel</page>, <page>Entity:SetAngles</page>, <page>Entity:SetPos</page>, <page>Entity:SetSkin</page>, <page>duplicator.DoFlex</page>, <page>duplicator.DoBoneManipulator</page>, <page>Entity:SetModelScale</page>, <page>Entity:SetCollisionGroup</page>, <page>Entity:SetName</page>, <page>Entity:SetBodygroup</page> on ent.


If ent has a RestoreNetworkVars function, it is called with data.DT.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to be applied upon

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to be applied onto the entity

functions.name: DoGenericPhysics
functions.description:
"Applies bone data, generically."


If data contains a PhysicsObjects table, it moves, re-angles and if relevent freezes all specified bones, first converting from local coordinates to world coordinates.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to be applied upon

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player who owns the entity. Unused in function as of early 2013

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The data to be applied onto the entity

functions.name: FindEntityClass
functions.description: Returns the entity class factory registered with <page>duplicator.RegisterEntityClass</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the entity class factory

returnValues.description:
Is compromised of the following members:
* <page>function</page> Func - The function that creates the entity
* <page>table</page> Args - Arguments to pass to the function

functions.name: GenericDuplicatorFunction
functions.description:
"Generic function for duplicating stuff"


This is called when <page>duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable</page> can't find an entity factory to build with. It calls <page>duplicator.DoGeneric</page> and <page>duplicator.DoGenericPhysics</page> to apply standard duplicator stored things such as the model and position.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player who wants to create something

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The duplication data to build the entity with

functions.name: GetAllConstrainedEntitiesAndConstraints
functions.description: <internal></internal> Fills entStorageTable with all of the entities in a group connected with constraints. Fills constraintStorageTable with all of the constrains constraining the group.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to start from

arguments.name: entStorageTable
arguments.description: The table the entities will be inserted into

arguments.name: constraintStorageTable
arguments.description: The table the constraints will be inserted into

functions.name: IsAllowed
functions.description: Returns whether the entity can be duplicated or not

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: An entity's classname

returnValues.description: Returns true if the entity can be duplicated (nil otherwise)

functions.name: Paste
functions.description:
"Given entity list and constraint list, create all entities and return their tables"

Calls <page>duplicator.CreateEntityFromTable</page> on each sub-table of EntityList. If an entity is actually created, it calls <page>ENTITY:OnDuplicated</page> with the entity's duplicator data, then <page>duplicator.ApplyEntityModifiers</page>, <page>duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers</page> and finally  <page>ENTITY:PostEntityPaste</page> is called.

The constraints are then created with <page>duplicator.CreateConstraintFromTable</page>.

arguments.name: Player
arguments.description: The player who wants to create something

arguments.name: EntityList
arguments.description: A table of duplicator data to create the entities from

arguments.name: ConstraintList
arguments.description: A table of duplicator data to create the constraints from

functions.name: RegisterBoneModifier
functions.description:
Registers a function to be called on each of an entity's bones when <page>duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers</page> is called.

<note>This function is available to call on the client, but registered functions aren't used anywhere!</note>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The type of the key doesn't appear to matter, but it is preferable to use a string.

arguments.name: boneModifier
arguments.description:
Function called on each bone that an ent has. Called during <page>duplicator.ApplyBoneModifiers</page>.
Function parameters are:
* <page>Player</page> ply
* <page>Entity</page> ent
* <page>number</page> boneID
* <page>PhysObj</page> bone
* <page>table</page> data


The data table that is passed to boneModifier is set with <page>duplicator.StoreBoneModifier</page>

functions.name: RegisterConstraint
functions.description: Register a function used for creating a duplicated constraint.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The unique name of new constraint

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: Function to be called when this constraint is created
Arguments passed to the callback function

functions.name: RegisterEntityClass
functions.description:
This allows you to specify a specific function to be run when your SENT is pasted with the duplicator, instead of relying on the generic automatic functions.

<note>Automatically calls <page>duplicator.Allow</page> for the entity class.</note>

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The ClassName of the entity you wish to register a factory for

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: The factory function you want to have called. It should have the arguments (Player, ...) where ... is whatever arguments you request to be passed. It also should return the entity created, otherwise <page>duplicator.Paste</page> result will not include it!

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: Strings of the names of arguments you want passed to function the from the <page>Structures/EntityCopyData</page>. As a special case, "Data" will pass the whole structure.

functions.name: RegisterEntityModifier
functions.description:
This allows you to register tweaks to entities. For instance, if you were making an "unbreakable" addon, you would use this to enable saving the "unbreakable" state of entities between duplications.

This function registers a piece of generic code that is run on all entities with this modifier. In order to have it actually run, use <page>duplicator.StoreEntityModifier</page>.

This function does nothing when run clientside.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: An identifier for your modification. This is not limited, so be verbose. "Person's 'Unbreakable' mod" is far less likely to cause conflicts than "unbreakable"

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to be called for your modification. It should have the arguments (Player, Entity, Data), where data is what you pass to <page>duplicator.StoreEntityModifier</page>.

functions.name: RemoveMapCreatedEntities
functions.description:
Help to remove certain map created entities before creating the saved entities
This is obviously so we don't get duplicate props everywhere.
It should be called before calling Paste.

functions.name: SetLocalAng
functions.description:
"When a copy is copied it will be translated according to these.
If you set them - make sure to set them back to 0 0 0!"

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: The angle to offset all pastes from

functions.name: SetLocalPos
functions.description:
"When a copy is copied it will be translated according to these.
If you set them - make sure to set them back to 0 0 0!"

arguments.name: v
arguments.description: The position to offset all pastes from

functions.name: StoreBoneModifier
functions.description: Stores bone mod data for a registered bone modification function

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to add bone mod data to

arguments.name: boneID
arguments.description:
The bone ID.
See <page>Entity:GetPhysicsObjectNum</page>

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key for the bone modification

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The bone modification data that is passed to the bone modification function

functions.name: StoreEntityModifier
functions.description: Stores an entity modifier into an entity for saving

arguments.name: entity
arguments.description: The entity to store modifier in

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Unique modifier name as defined in <page>duplicator.RegisterEntityModifier</page>

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: Modifier data

functions.name: WorkoutSize
functions.description: "Work out the AABB size"

arguments.name: Ents
arguments.description: A table of entity duplication datums.

name: effects
description: The effects library allows you to manually add scripted effects.

functions.name: BeamRingPoint
functions.description: Creates a "beam ring point" effect.

arguments.name: pos
arguments.description: The origin position of the effect

arguments.name: lifetime
arguments.description: How long the effect will be drawing for, in seconds

arguments.name: startRad
arguments.description: Initial radius of the effect

arguments.name: endRad
arguments.description: Final radius of the effect, at the end of the effect's lifetime

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: How thick the beam should be

arguments.name: amplitude
arguments.description: How noisy the beam should be

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Beam's <page>Global.Color</page>

arguments.name: extra
arguments.description:
Extra info, all optional. A table with the following keys: (any combination)
* <page>number</page> speed - ?
* <page>number</page> spread - ?
* <page>number</page> delay - Delay in seconds after which the effect should appear
* <page>number</page> flags- Beam flags
* <page>number</page> framerate - texture framerate
* <page>string</page> material - The material to use instead of the default one

functions.name: Bubbles
functions.description: Creates a bunch of bubbles inside a defined box.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The lowest extents of the box

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The highest extents of the box

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: How many bubbles to spawn. There's a hard limit of 500 tempents at any time.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: How high the bubbles can fly up before disappearing

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: How quickly the bubbles move

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds after the function call and before the effect actually spawns

functions.name: BubbleTrail
functions.description: Creates a bubble trail effect, the very same you get when shooting underwater.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The start position of the effect

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The end position of the effects

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: How many bubbles to spawn. There's a hard limit of 500 tempents at any time.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: How high the bubbles can fly up before disappearing

arguments.name: speed
arguments.description: How quickly the bubbles move

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: Delay in seconds after the function call and before the effect actually spawns

functions.name: Create
functions.description: <internal>You are looking for <page>util.Effect</page>.</internal>Returns the table of the effect specified.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Effect name.

functions.name: GetList
functions.description: <internal>Returns a list of all Lua-defined effects.</internal>

functions.name: Register
functions.description: <internal></internal>Registers a new effect.

arguments.name: effect_table
arguments.description: Effect table.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Effect name.

name: engine
description: The engine library provides functions to access various features in the game's engine, most are related to the demo and save systems.

functions.name: ActiveGamemode
functions.description: Returns the name of the currently running gamemode.

returnValues.description: The active gamemode's name. This is the name of the gamemode's folder.

functions.name: CloseServer
functions.description:
Closes the server and completely exits.

This is only functional when running in server test mode (launch option -systemtest). Server test mode is used internally at Facepunch as part of the build process to make sure that the dedicated servers aren't crashing on startup.

functions.name: GetAddons
functions.description:
Returns a list of addons the player have subscribed to on the workshop.

This list will also include "Floating" .gma addons that are mounted by the game, but not the folder addons.

returnValues.description: A table with 6 keys (downloaded, models, title, file, mounted, wsid)

functions.name: GetDemoPlaybackStartTick
functions.description: When starting playing a demo, <page>engine.GetDemoPlaybackTick</page> will be reset and its old value will be added to this functions return value.

functions.name: GetDemoPlaybackTick
functions.description:
Current tick of currently loaded demo.

If not playing a demo, it will return amount of ticks since last demo playback.

returnValues.description: The amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

functions.name: GetDemoPlaybackTimeScale
functions.description:
Returns time scale of demo playback.

If not during demo playback, returns 1.

returnValues.description: The time scale of demo playback, value of demo_timescale console variable.

functions.name: GetDemoPlaybackTotalTicks
functions.description:
Returns total amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

If not playing a demo, returns 0 or the value of last played demo.

returnValues.description: Total amount of ticks of currently loaded demo.

functions.name: GetGamemodes
functions.description: Returns a table containing info for all installed gamemodes

functions.name: GetGames
functions.description: Returns an array of tables corresponding to all games from which Garry's Mod supports mounting content.

returnValues.description: A table of tables containing all mountable games

functions.name: GetUserContent
functions.description:
<deprecated>Used internally for in-game menus, may be merged in the future into <page>engine.GetAddons</page>.</deprecated>

Returns the UGC (demos, saves and dupes) the player have subscribed to on the workshop.

returnValues.description: Returns a table with 6 keys (title, type, tags, wsid, timeadded)

functions.name: IsPlayingDemo
functions.description:
Returns true if we're currently playing a demo.

You will notice that there's no server-side version of this. That's because there is no server when playing a demo. Demos are both recorded and played back purely clientside.

returnValues.description: Whether the game is currently playing a demo or not.

functions.name: IsRecordingDemo
functions.description: Returns true if the game is currently recording a demo file (.dem) using gm_demo

returnValues.description: Whether the game is currently recording a demo or not.

functions.name: LightStyle
functions.description:
This is a direct binding to the function engine->LightStyle. This function allows you to change the default light style of the map - so you can make lighting lighter or darker. Youll need to call <page>render.RedownloadAllLightmaps</page> clientside to refresh the lightmaps to this new color.

<bug issue="3626">Calling this function with arguments 0 and "a" will cause dynamic lights such as those produced by the Light tool to stop working.</bug>

arguments.name: lightstyle
arguments.description: The lightstyle to edit. 0 to 63. If you want to edit map lighting, you want to set this to 0.

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.description: The pattern to change the lightstyle to. "a" is the darkest, "z" is the brightest. You can use stuff like "abcxyz" to make flashing patterns. The normal brightness for a map is "m". Values over "z" are allowed, "~" for instance.

functions.name: OpenDupe
functions.description: Loads a duplication from the local filesystem.

arguments.name: dupeName
arguments.description: Name of the file. e.g, engine.OpenDupe("dupes/8b809dd7a1a9a375e75be01cdc12e61f.dupe")

returnValues.description: Compressed dupeData. Use util.JSONToTable to make it into a format useable by the duplicator tool.

functions.name: ServerFrameTime
functions.description: Returns an estimate of the server's performance. Equivalent to calling <page>Global.FrameTime</page> from the server, according to source code.

functions.name: SetMounted
functions.description: Sets the mounting options for mountable content.

arguments.name: depotID
arguments.description: The depot id of the game to mount.

arguments.name: doMount
arguments.description: The mount state, true to mount, false to unmount

functions.name: TickCount
functions.description: Returns the number of ticks since the game server started.

returnValues.description: Number of ticks since the game server started.

functions.name: TickInterval
functions.description: Returns the number of seconds between each gametick.

returnValues.description: Number of seconds between each gametick.

functions.name: VideoSettings
functions.description: Returns video recording settings set by <page>video.Record</page>. Used by Demo-To-Video feature.

functions.name: WriteDupe
functions.description: Saves a duplication as a file.

arguments.name: dupe
arguments.description: Dupe table, encoded by <page>util.TableToJSON</page> and compressed by <page>util.Compress</page>

arguments.name: jpeg
arguments.description: The dupe icon, created by <page>render.Capture</page>

functions.name: WriteSave
functions.description: Stores savedata into the game (can be loaded using the LoadGame menu)

arguments.name: saveData
arguments.description: Data generated by gmsave.SaveMap

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name the save will have.

arguments.name: time
arguments.description: When the save was saved during the game (Put CurTime here)

arguments.name: map
arguments.description: The map the save is used for.

name: ents
description: The ents library provides functions for creating and finding entities in the game.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
Creates an entity. This function will fail and return NULL if the networked-edict limit is hit (around 8176), or the provided entity class doesn't exist.

<warning>Do not use before <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> has been called, otherwise the server will crash!
If you need to perform entity creation when the game starts, create a hook for <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> and do it there.</warning>

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The classname of the entity to create

returnValues.description: The created entity, or NULL if failed

functions.name: CreateClientProp
functions.description:
Creates a clientside only prop. See also <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page>.

For physics to work you **must** use the _model_ argument, a simple `SetModel` call will not be enough.

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The model for the entity to be created.

functions.name: CreateClientside
functions.description: Creates a clientside only scripted entity. The scripted entity must be of "anim" type.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The class name of the entity to create.

functions.name: FindAlongRay
functions.description: Returns a table of all entities along the ray. The ray does not stop on collisions, meaning it will go through walls/entities.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: The start position of the ray

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: The end position of the ray

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The mins corner of the ray

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The maxs corner of the ray

functions.name: FindByClass
functions.description:
Gets all entities with the given class, supports wildcards. This works internally by iterating over <page>ents.GetAll</page>. Even if internally ents.GetAll is used, It is faster to use ents.FindByClass than ents.GetAll with a single class comparison.

<note>Asterisks (*) are the only wildcard supported.</note>

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The class of the entities to find.

returnValues.description: A table containing all found entities

functions.name: FindByClassAndParent
functions.description: Finds all entities that are of given class and are children of given entity. This works internally by iterating over <page>ents.GetAll</page>.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: The class of entities to search for

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: Parent of entities that are being searched for

returnValues.description: A table of found entities or nil if none are found

functions.name: FindByModel
functions.description:
Gets all entities with the given model, supports wildcards. This works internally by iterating over <page>ents.GetAll</page>.

<bug issue="2872">This currently only supports trailing asterisks (*) for wildcards.</bug>

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The model of the entities to find.

returnValues.description: A table of all found entities.

functions.name: FindByName
functions.description:
Gets all entities with the given hammer targetname. This works internally by iterating over <page>ents.GetAll</page>.

<note>A player's Name is his nickname, see <page>Player:GetName</page></note>

Doesn't do anything on client.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The targetname to look for

returnValues.description: A table of all found entities

functions.name: FindInBox
functions.description:
Returns all entities within the specified box.

<note>Clientside entities will not be returned by this function.</note>

<warning>There is a limit of 512 entities for the output!</warning>

arguments.name: boxMins
arguments.description: The box minimum coordinates.

arguments.name: boxMaxs
arguments.description: The box maximum coordinates.

returnValues.description: A table of all found entities.

functions.name: FindInCone
functions.description: Finds and returns all entities within the specified cone. Only entities whose Entity:WorldSpaceCenter is within the cone are considered to be in it. The "cone" is actually a conical "slice" of an axis-aligned box (see: ents.FindInBox). The image to the right shows approximately how this function would look in 2D. Due to this, the entity may be farther than the specified range! Clientside entities will not be returned by this function. If there are more than 512 entities in the axis-aligned box around the origin, then the result may be incomplete!

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: The tip of the cone.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: Direction of the cone.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description:
The range of the cone/box around the origin.
<note> The function internally adds 1 to this argument before using it. </note>

arguments.name: angle_cos
arguments.description:
The <page text="cosine">math.cos</page> of the angle between the center of the cone to its edges, which is half the overall angle of the cone.

1 makes a 0 cone, 0.707 makes approximately 90, 0 makes 180, and so on.

functions.name: FindInPVS
functions.description:
Finds all entities that lie within a [PVS](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/PVS).

<note>The function won't take in to account <page>Global.AddOriginToPVS</page> and the like.</note>

arguments.name: viewPoint
arguments.description: <page>Entity</page> or <page>Vector</page> to find entities within the PVS of. If a player is given, this function will use the player's view entity.

functions.name: FindInSphere
functions.description:
Gets all entities within the specified sphere.

<note>Clientside entities will not be returned by this function.</note>

arguments.name: origin
arguments.description: Center of the sphere.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Radius of the sphere.

returnValues.description: A table of all found <page>Entity</page>s. Has a limit of 1024 entities.

functions.name: FireTargets
functions.description: Fires a use event.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: Name of the target entity.

arguments.name: activator
arguments.description: Activator of the event.

arguments.name: caller
arguments.description: Caller of the event.

arguments.name: usetype
arguments.description: Use type. See the <page>Enums/USE</page>.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: This value is passed to <page>ENTITY:Use</page>, but isn't used by any default entities in the engine.

functions.name: GetAll
functions.description: Returns a table of all existing entities. The table is sequential

functions.name: GetByIndex
functions.description: Returns an entity by its index. Same as <page>Global.Entity</page>.

arguments.name: entIdx
arguments.description: The index of the entity.

functions.name: GetCount
functions.description:
Gives you the amount of currently existing entities.
Similar to #<page>ents.GetAll</page> but with much better performance.

arguments.name: IncludeKillMe
arguments.description: Include entities with the FL_KILLME flag. This will skip an internal loop, and the function will be more efficient as a byproduct.

functions.name: GetEdictCount
functions.description: Returns the amount of networked entities, which is limited to 8192. <page>ents.Create</page> will fail somewhere between 8064 and 8176 - this can vary based on the amount of existing temp ents.

functions.name: GetMapCreatedEntity
functions.description: Returns entity that has given <page>Entity:MapCreationID</page>.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Entity's creation id

name: file
description:
The file library provides functions for finding, reading and writing to files.
The following path values are most commonly used: * `LUA` searches the lua files (in /lua/, in your gamemodes, in all the addons). * `GAME` searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc). * `MOD` searches only the garrysmod folder. * `DATA` searches in the data folder. See File Search Paths for the descriptive list of path values. For the full list of path values, type `path` in the console.

functions.name: Append
functions.description: Appends a file relative to the `data` folder.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The file's name.

arguments.name: content
arguments.description: The content which should be appended to the file.

functions.name: CreateDir
functions.description: Creates a directory that is relative to the `data` folder.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The directory's name.

functions.name: Delete
functions.description:
Deletes a file or `empty` folder that is relative to the **data** folder.
You can't remove any files outside of **data** folder.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The file name

functions.name: Exists
functions.description: Returns a boolean of whether the file or directory exists or not.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The file or directory's name.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path of where to look for the file.

* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the file exists and false if it does not.

functions.name: Find
functions.description: Returns a list of files and directories inside a single folder.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The wildcard to search for. "models/*.mdl" will list .mdl files in the models/ folder.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The path to look for the files and directories in. See <page text="this list">File_Search_Paths</page> for a list of valid paths.

arguments.name: sorting
arguments.description:
The sorting to be used, optional.

* "nameasc" sort the files ascending by name
* "namedesc" sort the files descending by name
* "dateasc" sort the files ascending by date
* "datedesc" sort the files descending by date

returnValues.description: A table of found files, or nil if the path is invalid
A table of found directories, or nil if the path is invalid

functions.name: IsDir
functions.description: Returns whether the given file is a directory or not.

arguments.name: fileName
arguments.description: The file or directory's name.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The path type.

returnValues.description: True if the given path is a directory or false if it is a file.

functions.name: Open
functions.description: Attempts to open a file with the given mode.

arguments.name: fileName
arguments.description: The files name. See <page>file.Write</page> for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

arguments.name: fileMode
arguments.description:
The mode to open the file in. Possible values are:
* **r** - read mode
* **w** - write mode
* **a** - append mode
* **rb** - binary read mode
* **wb** - binary write mode
* **ab** - binary append mode

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path type. See <page>File Search Paths</page>

Common paths are:
* "GAME" - Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" - Local to Data folder, has write access (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" - Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

returnValues.description: The opened file object, or nil if it failed to open due to it not existing or being used by another process.

functions.name: Read
functions.description:
Returns the content of a file.

Beware of casing -- some filesystems are case-sensitive. SRCDS on Linux seems to force file/directory creation to lowercase, but will not modify read operations.

arguments.name: fileName
arguments.description: The name of the file.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path used to look up the file.
* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

It can also be a boolean:
* true = "GAME"
* false = "DATA"

returnValues.description: The data from the file as a string, or nil if the file isn't found

functions.name: Rename
functions.description:
Attempts to rename a file with the given name to another given name.

This function is constrained to the data/ folder.

arguments.name: orignalFileName
arguments.description:
The original file or folder name. See <page>file.Write</page> for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

This argument will be forced lowercase.

arguments.name: targetFileName
arguments.description:
The target file or folder name. See <page>file.Write</page> for details on filename restrictions when writing to files.

This argument will be forced lowercase.

functions.name: Size
functions.description: Returns the file's size in bytes. If the file is not found, returns -1.

arguments.name: fileName
arguments.description: The file's name.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path type.

* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

functions.name: Time
functions.description: Returns when the file or folder was lasted modified in Unix time.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The **file** or **folder** path.

arguments.name: gamePath
arguments.description:
The game path to be used.

* "GAME" Structured like base folder (garrysmod/), searches all the mounted content (main folder, addons, mounted games etc)
* "LUA" or "lsv" - All Lua folders (lua/) including gamesmodes and addons
* "DATA" Data folder (garrysmod/data)
* "MOD" Strictly the game folder (garrysmod/), ignores mounting.

functions.name: Write
functions.description: Writes the given string to a file. Erases all previous data in the file. To add data without deleting previous data, use <page>file.Append</page>.

arguments.name: fileName
arguments.description:
The name of the file being written into. The path is relative to the **data/** folder.

This argument will be forced lowercase.

The filename **must** end with one of the following:
* .txt
* .jpg
* .png
* .vtf
* .dat
* .json


Restricted symbols are: ```" : ```

arguments.name: content
arguments.description: The content that will be written into the file.

name: frame_blend
description: The frame blending library.

functions.name: AddFrame
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Adds a frame to the blend. Calls <page>frame_blend.CompleteFrame</page> once enough frames have passed since last <page>frame_blend.CompleteFrame</page> call.

functions.name: BlendFrame
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Blends the frame(s).

functions.name: CompleteFrame
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Renders the frame onto internal render target.

functions.name: DrawPreview
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Actually draws the frame blend effect.

functions.name: IsActive
functions.description: Returns whether frame blend post processing effect is enabled or not.

returnValues.description: Is frame blend enabled or not

functions.name: IsLastFrame
functions.description:
<internal></internal>


Returns whether the current frame is the last frame?

returnValues.description: Whether the current frame is the last frame?

functions.name: RenderableFrames
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Returns amount of frames needed to render?

returnValues.description: Amount of frames needed to render?

functions.name: ShouldSkipFrame
functions.description: Returns whether we should skip frame or not

returnValues.description: Should the frame be skipped or not

name: game
description: The game library provides functions to access various features in the game's engine, most of it's functions are related to controlling the map.

functions.name: AddAmmoType
functions.description:
Adds a new ammo type to the game.

You can find a list of default ammo types <page text="here">Default_Ammo_Types</page>.

<warning>This function must be called shared or you will have unexpected problems.</warning>
<note>This function must be called in <page>GM:Initialize</page>.</note>
<note>There is a limit of 128 ammo types, including the default ones.</note>

arguments.name: ammoData
arguments.description: The attributes of the ammo. See the <page>Structures/AmmoData</page>.

functions.name: AddDecal
functions.description:
Registers a new decal.

<warning>There's a rather low limit of around 256 for decal materials that may be registered and they are not cleared on map load.</warning>

arguments.name: decalName
arguments.description: The name of the decal.

arguments.name: materialName
arguments.description: The material to be used for the decal. May also be a list of material names, in which case a random material from that list will be chosen every time the decal is placed.

functions.name: AddParticles
functions.description:
Loads a particle file.

<note>You will still need to call this function clientside regardless if you create the particle effects serverside.</note>

arguments.name: particleFileName
arguments.description: The path of the file to add. Must be (file).pcf.

functions.name: BuildAmmoTypes
functions.description:
<internal>Consider using <page>game.GetAmmoTypes</page> and <page>game.GetAmmoData</page> instead.</internal>
Called by the engine to retrieve the ammo types.

returnValues.description: All ammo types registered via <page>game.AddAmmoType</page>, sorted by its name value.

functions.name: CleanUpMap
functions.description:
If called serverside it will remove ALL entities which were not created by the map(not players or weapons held by players).

On the client it will remove decals, sounds, gibs, dead NPCs, and entities created via <page>ents.CreateClientProp</page>.

This function calls <page>GM:PreCleanupMap</page> before cleaning up the map and <page>GM:PostCleanupMap</page> after cleaning up the map.

<bug issue="1142">Calling this in a <page>ENTITY:StartTouch</page> or <page>ENTITY:Touch</page> hook will crash the game.</bug>

<bug issue="2874">Calling this destroys all BASS streams.</bug>

<bug issue="3637">This can crash when removing _firesmoke entities.</bug>

arguments.name: dontSendToClients
arguments.description: If set to true, don't run this functions on all clients.

arguments.name: ExtraFilters
arguments.description: Entity classes not to reset during cleanup.

functions.name: ConsoleCommand
functions.description:
Runs a console command.
Make sure to add a newline ("\n") at the end of the command.

<warning>If you use data that were received from a client, you should avoid using this function because newline and semicolon (at least) allow the client to run arbitrary commands!

For safety, you are urged to prefer using <page>Global.RunConsoleCommand</page> in this case.</warning>

arguments.name: stringCommand
arguments.description: String containing the command and arguments to be ran.

functions.name: GetAmmoDamageType
functions.description: Returns the damage type of given ammo type.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage type of. Starts from 1.

functions.name: GetAmmoData
functions.description: Returns the <page>Structures/AmmoData</page> for given ID.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: ID of the ammo type to look up the data for

functions.name: GetAmmoForce
functions.description: Returns the ammo bullet force that is applied when an entity is hit by a bullet of given ammo type.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo ID to retrieve the force of. Starts from 1.

functions.name: GetAmmoID
functions.description:
Returns the ammo type ID for given ammo type name.

See <page>game.GetAmmoName</page> for reverse.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the ammo type to look up ID of

returnValues.description: The ammo type ID of given ammo type name, or -1 if not found

functions.name: GetAmmoMax
functions.description:
Returns the real maximum amount of ammo of given ammo ID.

<note>Currently all ammo types have overridden maximum value of reserve ammo set to 9999.</note>

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo type ID

returnValues.description: The maximum amount of reserve ammo a player can hold of this ammo type.

functions.name: GetAmmoName
functions.description:
Returns the ammo name for given ammo type ID.

See <page>game.GetAmmoID</page> for reverse.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo ID to retrieve the name of. Starts from 1.

returnValues.description: The name of given ammo type ID or nil if ammo type ID is invalid.

functions.name: GetAmmoNPCDamage
functions.description: Returns the damage given ammo type should do to NPCs.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage info of. Starts from 1.

functions.name: GetAmmoPlayerDamage
functions.description: Returns the damage given ammo type should do to players.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: Ammo ID to retrieve the damage info of. Starts from 1.

functions.name: GetAmmoTypes
functions.description: Returns a list of all ammo types currently registered.

returnValues.description: A table containing all ammo types. The keys are ammo IDs, the values are the names associated with those IDs.

functions.name: GetGlobalCounter
functions.description:
Returns the counter of a Global State.

See <page>Global States</page> for more information.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the Global State to set.

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See <page>Global States</page> for a list of default global states.

returnValues.description: The value of the given Global State, 0 if the global state doesn't exist.

functions.name: GetGlobalState
functions.description:
Returns whether a Global State is off, active or dead ( inactive )

See <page>Global States</page> for more information.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the Global State to retrieve the state of.

If the Global State by that name does not exist, **GLOBAL_DEAD** will be returned.

See <page>Global States</page> for a list of default global states.

returnValues.description: The state of the Global State. See <page>Enums/GLOBAL</page>

functions.name: GetIPAddress
functions.description:
Returns the public IP address and port of the current server. This will return the IP/port that you are connecting through when ran clientside.
<note>Returns "0.0.0.0:0" in singleplayer.</note>

<bug issue="3001">Returns "0.0.0.0:`port`" on the server when called too early, including in <page>GM:Initialize</page> and <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page>. This bug seems to only happen the first time a server is launched, and will return the correct value after switching maps.</bug>

returnValues.description: The IP address and port in the format "x.x.x.x:x"

functions.name: GetMap
functions.description:
Returns the name of the current map, without a file extension.
On the menu state, returns "menu".

returnValues.description: The name of the current map, without a file extension.

functions.name: GetMapNext
functions.description: Returns the next map that would be loaded according to the file that is set by the mapcyclefile convar.

functions.name: GetMapVersion
functions.description: Returns the VBSP version of the current map.

returnValues.description: VBSP version of the currently loaded map, will be either 19, 20 or 21 for L4D1+ maps

functions.name: GetSkillLevel
functions.description:
Returns the difficulty level of the game.

**TIP:** You can use this function in your scripted NPCs or Nextbots to make them harder, however, it is a good idea to lock powerful attacks behind the highest difficulty instead of just increasing the health.

<note>Internally this is tied to the gamerules entity, so you'll have to wait to wait until <page>GM:InitPostEntity</page> is called to return the skill level</note>

returnValues.description: The difficulty level, Easy( 1 ), Normal( 2 ), Hard( 3 ).

functions.name: GetTimeScale
functions.description: Returns the time scale of the game

functions.name: GetWorld
functions.description: Returns the worldspawn entity.

functions.name: IsDedicated
functions.description:
Returns true if the server is a dedicated server, false if it is a  or a singleplayer game.

<bug issue="1495">This always returns false on the client.</bug>

returnValues.description: Is the server dedicated or not.

functions.name: KickID
functions.description: Kicks a player from the server. This can be ran before the player has spawned.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: UserID or SteamID of the player to kick.

arguments.name: reason
arguments.description:
Reason to display to the player. This can span across multiple lines.

<warning>This will be shortened to ~512 chars, though this includes the command itself and the player index so will realistically be more around ~498. It is recommended to avoid going near the limit to avoid truncation.</warning>

functions.name: LoadNextMap
functions.description: Loads the next map according to the nextlevel convar, or from the current mapcycle file set by the respective convar.

functions.name: MapLoadType
functions.description:
Returns the map load type of the current map.

After changing the map with the console command `changelevel`, "newgame" is returned. With `changelevel2` (single player only), "transition" is returned.

returnValues.description: The load type. Possible values are: "newgame", "loadgame", "transition", "background".

functions.name: MaxPlayers
functions.description: Returns the maximum amount of players (including bots) that the server can have.

functions.name: MountGMA
functions.description:
Mounts a GMA addon from the disk. Any error models currently loaded that the mounted addon provides will be reloaded.

Can be used with <page>steamworks.DownloadUGC</page>

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: Location of the GMA file to mount, retrieved from <page>steamworks.DownloadUGC</page>

returnValues.description: If successful, a table of files that have been mounted

functions.name: RemoveRagdolls
functions.description: Removes all the clientside ragdolls.

functions.name: SetGlobalCounter
functions.description:
Sets the counter of a Global State.

See <page>Global States</page> for more information.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the Global State to set.

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See <page>Global States</page> for a list of default global states.

arguments.name: count
arguments.description: The value to set for that Global State.

functions.name: SetGlobalState
functions.description:
Sets whether a Global State is off, active or dead ( inactive )

See <page>Global States</page> for more information.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the Global State to set.

If the Global State by that name does not exist, it will be created.

See <page>Global States</page> for a list of default global states.

arguments.name: state
arguments.description: The state of the Global State. See <page>Enums/GLOBAL</page>

functions.name: SetSkillLevel
functions.description:
Sets the difficulty level of the game, can be retrieved with <page>game.GetSkillLevel</page>.

This will automatically change whenever the "skill" convar is modified serverside.

<bug issue="3491">This function will not work if the skill convar doesn't match the targeted value. To work around this, you must use RunConsoleCommand("skill", num) alongside this function.</bug>

arguments.name: level
arguments.description: The difficulty level, Easy( 1 ), Normal( 2 ), Hard( 3 ).

functions.name: SetTimeScale
functions.description:
Sets the time scale of the game.

This function is supposed to remove the need of using the host_timescale convar, which is cheat protected.

To slow down or speed up the movement of a specific player, use <page>Player:SetLaggedMovementValue</page> instead.

<note>Like host_timescale, this method does not affect sounds, if you wish to change that, look into <page>GM:EntityEmitSound</page>.</note>

arguments.name: timeScale
arguments.description: The new timescale, minimum value is 0.001 and maximum is 5.

functions.name: SinglePlayer
functions.description: Returns whenever the current session is a single player game.

functions.name: StartSpot
functions.description: Returns position the player should start from, this is not the same thing as spawn points, it is used to properly transit the player between maps.

name: gameevent
description: Used to interface with the built in game events system.

functions.name: Listen
functions.description: Add a game event listener.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description:
The event to listen to, travels through hooks with eventName as event.
List of valid events can be found Game_Events.

name: gamemode
description: The gamemode library provides functions relating to the gamemode system in Garry's Mod.

functions.name: Call
functions.description:
Called by the engine to call a hook within the loaded gamemode.

The supplied event 'name' must be defined in the active gamemode. Otherwise, nothing will happen - not even hooks added with <page>hook.Add</page> will be called.

This is similar to <page>hook.Run</page> and <page>hook.Call</page>, except the hook library will call hooks created with hook.Add even if there is no corresponding gamemode function.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the hook to call.

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: The arguments

returnValues.description: The result of the hook function - can be up to 6 values. Returns false if the gamemode function doesn't exist (i.e. nothing happened), but remember - a hook can also return false.

functions.name: Get
functions.description: <internal></internal> This returns the internally stored gamemode table.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the gamemode you want to get

functions.name: Register
functions.description: <internal></internal>Called by the engine when a gamemode is being loaded.

arguments.name: gm
arguments.description: Your GM table

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of your gamemode, lowercase, no spaces.

arguments.name: derived
arguments.description: The gamemode name that your gamemode is derived from

name: gmod
description: Similar purpose to the <page>game</page> and <page>engine</page>, allows access to various features of the game's engine.

functions.name: GetGamemode
functions.description: Returns <page>GAMEMODE</page>.

name: gmsave
description: The gmsave library provides functions relating to the singleplayer save system in Garry's Mod.

functions.name: LoadMap
functions.description: Loads a saved map.

arguments.name: mapData
arguments.description: The JSON encoded string containing all the map data.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player to load positions for

functions.name: PlayerLoad
functions.description: Sets player position and angles from supplied table

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player to "load" values for

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: A table containing Origin and Angle keys for position and angles to set.

functions.name: PlayerSave
functions.description: Returns a table containing player position and angles. Used by <page>gmsave.SaveMap</page>.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player to "save"

returnValues.description: A table containing player position ( Origin ) and angles ( Angle )

functions.name: SaveMap
functions.description: Saves the map

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player, whose position should be saved for loading the save

returnValues.description: The encoded to JSON string containing save data

functions.name: ShouldSaveEntity
functions.description: Returns if we should save this entity in a duplication or a map save or not.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity

arguments.name: t
arguments.description: A table containing classname key with entities classname.

name: gui
description: The gui library is similar to the <page>input</page> but features functions that are more focused on the mouse's interaction with GUI panels.

functions.name: ActivateGameUI
functions.description: Opens the game menu overlay.

functions.name: EnableScreenClicker
functions.description:
Enables the mouse cursor without restricting player movement, like using Sandbox's context menu.

<bug issue="982">Some <page>CUserCmd</page> functions will return incorrect values when this function is active.</bug>

arguments.name: enabled
arguments.description: Whether the cursor should be enabled or not. (true = enable, false = disable)

functions.name: HideGameUI
functions.description: Hides the game menu overlay.

functions.name: InternalCursorMoved
functions.description: Simulates a mouse move with the given deltas.

arguments.name: deltaX
arguments.description: The movement delta on the x axis.

arguments.name: deltaY
arguments.description: The movement delta on the y axis.

functions.name: InternalKeyCodePressed
functions.description: Simulates a key press for the given key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/KEY</page>.

functions.name: InternalKeyCodeReleased
functions.description: Simulates a key release for the given key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/KEY</page>.

functions.name: InternalKeyCodeTyped
functions.description: Simulates a key type typing to the specified key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/KEY</page>.

functions.name: InternalKeyTyped
functions.description:
Simulates an ASCII symbol writing.
Use to write text in the chat or in VGUI.
Doesn't work while the main menu is open!

arguments.name: code
arguments.description: ASCII code of symbol, see http://www.mikroe.com/img/publication/spa/pic-books/programming-in-basic/chapter/04/fig4-24.gif

functions.name: InternalMouseDoublePressed
functions.description: Simulates a double mouse key press for the given mouse key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

functions.name: InternalMousePressed
functions.description: Simulates a mouse key press for the given mouse key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

functions.name: InternalMouseReleased
functions.description: Simulates a mouse key release for the given mouse key.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>.

functions.name: InternalMouseWheeled
functions.description: Simulates a mouse wheel scroll with the given delta.

arguments.name: delta
arguments.description: The amount of scrolling to simulate.

functions.name: IsConsoleVisible
functions.description: Returns whether the console is visible or not.

returnValues.description: Whether the console is visible or not.

functions.name: IsGameUIVisible
functions.description: Returns whenever the game menu overlay ( main menu ) is open or not.

returnValues.description: Whenever the game menu overlay ( main menu ) is open or not

functions.name: MousePos
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>input.GetCursorPos</page> instead.</deprecated>

Returns the cursor's position on the screen, or 0, 0 if cursor is not visible.

functions.name: MouseX
functions.description: Returns x component of the mouse position.

functions.name: MouseY
functions.description: Returns y component of the mouse position.

functions.name: OpenURL
functions.description:
Opens specified URL in the steam overlay browser. The URL has to start with either http:// or https://

<note>When called clientside, user will be asked for confirmation before the website will open.</note>
<bug issue="3383">You can't click the confirmation if a model panel has focus.</bug>

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: URL to open

functions.name: ScreenToVector
functions.description:
Converts the specified screen position to a **direction** vector local to the player's view. A related function is <page>Vector:ToScreen</page>, which translates a 3D position to a screen coordinate.

<page>util.AimVector</page> is a more generic version of this, using a custom view instead of the player's current view.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X coordinate on the screen.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y coordinate on the screen.

functions.name: SetMousePos
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>input.SetCursorPos</page> instead.</deprecated>
Sets the cursor's position on the screen, relative to the topleft corner of the window

arguments.name: mouseX
arguments.description: The X coordinate to move the cursor to.

arguments.name: mouseY
arguments.description: The Y coordinate to move the cursor to.

functions.name: ShowConsole
functions.description: Shows console in the game UI.

name: GWEN
description: GWEN is a system that allows you to load a spritesheet and generate a skin out of it.

functions.name: CreateTextureBorder
functions.description: Used in derma skins to create a bordered rectangle drawing function from an image. The texture is taken either from last argument or from SKIN.GwenTexture

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the area on texture

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the area on texture

arguments.name: left
arguments.description: Left width of border

arguments.name: top
arguments.description: Top width of border

arguments.name: right
arguments.description: Right width of border

arguments.name: bottom
arguments.description: Bottom width of border

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: Texture of source image to create a bordered rectangle from. Uses SKIN.GwenTexture if not set.

returnValues.description:
The drawing function. Arguments are:
* <page>number</page> x - X coordinate for the box
* <page>number</page> y - Y coordinate for the box
* <page>number</page> w - Width of the box
* <page>number</page> h - Height of the box
* <page>table</page> clr - Optional color, default is white. Uses the <page>Color</page>

functions.name: CreateTextureCentered
functions.description: Used in derma skins to create a rectangle drawing function from an image. The rectangle will not be scaled, but instead it will be drawn in the center of the box. The texture is taken from SKIN.GwenTexture

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the area on texture

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the area on texture

returnValues.description:
The drawing function. Arguments are:
<page>number</page> x - X coordinate for the box


<page>number</page> y - Y coordinate for the box


<page>number</page> w - Width of the box


<page>number</page> h - Height of the box


<page>table</page> clr - Optional color, default is white. Uses the <page>Color</page>

functions.name: CreateTextureNormal
functions.description: Used in derma skins to create a rectangle drawing function from an image. The texture of the rectangle will be scaled. The texture is taken from SKIN.GwenTexture

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate on the texture

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the area on texture

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the area on texture

returnValues.description:
The drawing function. Arguments are:
* <page>number</page> x - X coordinate for the box
* <page>number</page> y - Y coordinate for the box
* <page>number</page> w - Width of the box
* <page>number</page> h - Height of the box
* <page>table</page> clr - Optional color, default is white. Uses the <page>Color</page>

functions.name: TextureColor
functions.description: When used in a material skin, it returns a color value from a point in the skin image.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X position of the pixel to get the color from.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y position of the pixel to get the color from.

returnValues.description: The color of the point on the skin as a <page>Color</page>.

name: halo
description: The halo library is used to draw glowing outlines around entities, an example of this can be seen by picking up props with the physgun in Garry's Mod 13.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Applies a <page>halo</page> glow effect to one or multiple entities.
<warning>Using this function outside of the <page>GM:PreDrawHalos</page> hook can cause instability or crashes.</warning>

arguments.name: entities
arguments.description: A table of entities to add the halo effect to

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The desired color of the halo. See <page>Color</page>

arguments.name: blurX
arguments.description: The strength of the halo's blur on the x axis.

arguments.name: blurY
arguments.description: The strength of the halo's blur on the y axis.

arguments.name: passes
arguments.description: The number of times the halo should be drawn per frame. Increasing this may hinder player FPS.

arguments.name: additive
arguments.description: Sets the render mode of the halo to additive.

arguments.name: ignoreZ
arguments.description: Renders the halo through anything when set to true.

functions.name: Render
functions.description: <internal></internal>Renders a halo according to the specified table, only used internally, called from a PostDrawEffects hook added by the halo library

arguments.name: entry
arguments.description: Table with info about the halo to draw.

functions.name: RenderedEntity
functions.description:
Returns the entity the halo library is currently rendering the halo for.

The main purpose of this function is to be used in <page>ENTITY:Draw</page> in order not to draw certain parts of the entity when the halo is being rendered, so there's no halo around unwanted entity parts, such as lasers, 3D2D displays, etc.

returnValues.description: If set, the currently rendered entity by the halo library.

name: hammer
description: The hammer library.

functions.name: SendCommand
functions.description: Sends command to Hammer, if Hammer is running with the current map loaded.

arguments.name: cmd
arguments.description:
Command to send including arguments

All commands are in the format "command var1 var2 etc"

All commands that pick an entity with x y z , must use the exact position including decimals. i.e. -354.4523 123.4

# List of commands
| Command       | Description   |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| "session_begin mapName mapVersion" | Starts a hammer edit, locking the editor. mapName is the current map without path or suffix, mapVersion is the current version in the .vmf file |
| "session_end" | Ends a hammer edit, unlocking the editor. |
| "map_check_version mapName mapVersion" | This only works after session_begin, so you'd know the right version already and this only returns ok, this function is apparently useless. |
| "entity_create entityClass x y z" | Creates an entity of entityClass at position x y z |
| "entity_delete entityClass x y z" | Deletes an entity of entityClass at position x y z |
| "entity_set_keyvalue entityClass x y z "key" "value"" | Set's the KeyValue pair of an entity of entityClass at x y z. The Key name and Value String must be in quotes. |
| "entity_rotate_incremental entityClass x y z incX incY incZ" | Rotates an entity of entityClass at x y z by incX incY incZ |
| "node_create nodeClass nodeID x y z" | Creates an AI node of nodeClass with nodeID at x y z you should keep nodeID unique or you will have issues |
| "node_delete nodeID" | Deletes node(s) with nodeID, this will delete multiple nodes if they have the same nodeID |
| "nodelink_create startNodeID endNodeID" | Creates a link between AI nodes startNodeID and endNodeID |
| "nodelink_delete startNodeID endNodeID" | Removes a link between AI nodes startNodeID and endNodeID |

returnValues.description:
Returns "ok" if command succeeded otherwise returns "badcommand"

**All changes only happen in hammer, there is *NO* in game representation/feedback**

name: hook
description: The hook library allows you to add hooks called by the game engine, allowing multiple scripts to modify game function.

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Add a hook to be called upon the given event occurring.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The event to hook on to. This can be any GM function, gameevent after using <page>gameevent.Listen</page>, or custom hook run with <page>hook.Call</page> or <page>hook.Run</page>.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description:
The unique identifier, usually a string. This can be used elsewhere in the code to replace or remove the hook. The identifier **should** be unique so that you do not accidentally override some other mods hook, unless that's what you are trying to do.

The identifier can be either a <page>string</page>, or a <page>table</page>/object with an IsValid function defined such as an <page>Entity</page> or <page>Panel</page>. <page>number</page>s and <page>boolean</page>s, for example, are not allowed.

If the identifier is a table/object, it will be inserted in front of the other arguments in the callback and the hook will be called as long as it's valid. However, as soon as IsValid( identifier ) returns false, the hook will be removed.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description:
The function to be called, arguments given to it depend on the .
<warning>Returning any value besides nil from the hook's function will stop other hooks of the same event down the loop from being executed. Only return a value when absolutely necessary and when you know what you are doing.

It WILL break other addons.</warning>

functions.name: Call
functions.description:
Calls all hooks associated with the given event until one returns something other than nil, and then returns that data.

In almost all cases, you should use <page>hook.Run</page> instead - it calls hook.Call internally but supplies the gamemode table by itself, making your code neater.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The event to call hooks for

arguments.name: gamemodeTable
arguments.description: If the gamemode is specified, the gamemode hook within will be called, otherwise not

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: The arguments to be passed to the hooks

returnValues.description: Return data from called hooks. Limited to 6 return values

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns a list of all the hooks registered with <page>hook.Add</page>.

returnValues.description: A table of tables. See below for output example.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description: Removes the hook with the supplied identifier from the given event.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The event name.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the hook to remove, usually a string.

functions.name: Run
functions.description:
Calls hooks associated with the given event.

Calls all hooks until one returns something other than nil and then returns that data.


If no hook returns any data, it will try to call the GAMEMODE:<eventName> alternative, if one exists.

This function internally calls <page>hook.Call</page>.

See also: <page>gamemode.Call</page> - same as this, but does not call hooks if the gamemode hasn't defined the function.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The event to call hooks for

arguments.name: args
arguments.description: The arguments to be passed to the hooks

name: http
description: The http library allows either the server or client to communicate with external websites via HTTP, both GET (<page>http.Fetch</page>) and POST (<page>http.Post</page>) are supported. A more powerful & advanced method can be used via the global <page>Global.HTTP</page> function.

functions.name: Fetch
functions.description:
Launches a GET request. HTTP-requests on private networks don't work.
To enable HTTP-requests on private networks use Command Line Parameters `-allowlocalhttp`

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the website to fetch.

arguments.name: onSuccess
arguments.description:
Function to be called on success. Arguments are
* <page>string</page> body
* <page>string</page> size - equal to <page>string.len</page>(body)
* <page>table</page> headers
* <page>number</page> code - The HTTP success code

arguments.name: onFailure
arguments.description:
Function to be called on failure. Arguments are
* <page>string</page> error - The error message

arguments.name: headers
arguments.description: KeyValue table for headers

functions.name: Post
functions.description:
Sends an asynchronous POST request to a HTTP server.

HTTP requests returning a status code >= 400 are still considered a success and will call the onSuccess callback.

The onFailure callback is usually only called on DNS or TCP errors (e.g. the website is unavailable or the domain does not exist)
<note>HTTP-requests on private networks don't work. To enable HTTP-requests on private networks use <page>Command Line Parameters</page> `-allowlocalhttp`</note>

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The url to of the website to fetch.

arguments.name: parameters
arguments.description: The post parameters to be send to the server. `'Keys and values `must'' be strings.

arguments.name: onSuccess
arguments.description: The function called on success: function( string responseText, number contentLength, table responseHeaders, number statusCode )

arguments.name: onFailure
arguments.description: The function called on failure: function( string errorMessage )

arguments.name: headers
arguments.description: KeyValue table for headers

name: input
description: The input library allows you to gather information about the clients input devices (mouse & keyboard), such as the cursor position and whether a key is pressed or not.

functions.name: CheckKeyTrapping

<note>Despite the name of the function, this also works for the full range of keys in <page>Enums/BUTTON_CODE</page>.</note>

Gets whether the specified button code is down.

Unlike <page>input.IsKeyDown</page> this can also detect joystick presses from <page>Enums/JOYSTICK</page>

arguments.name: button

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/KEY</page>.

functions.name: IsKeyTrapping
functions.description: Returns whether key trapping is activate and the next key press will be captured.

returnValues.description: Whether key trapping active or not

functions.name: IsMouseDown
functions.description: Gets whether a mouse button is down

arguments.name: mouseKey
arguments.description: The key, see <page>Enums/MOUSE</page>

functions.name: IsShiftDown
functions.description: Gets whether a shift key is being pressed

functions.name: LookupBinding

arguments.name: binding

arguments.name: exact
arguments.description: True if the binding should match exactly

returnValues.description:
The first key found with that binding or no value if no key with given binding was found.

See also <page>input.GetKeyCode</page>.
