arguments.description: The trace that is passed as second argument to Action callback of a property

name: render
description: The render library is a powerful set of functions that let you control how the world and its contents are rendered. It can also be used to draw some 3D clientside effects such as beams, boxes and spheres.

functions.name: AddBeam
functions.description: Adds a beam segment to the beam started by <page>render.StartBeam</page>.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: Beam start position.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the beam.

arguments.name: textureEnd
arguments.description: The end coordinate of the texture used.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to be used. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: BlurRenderTarget
functions.description: Blurs the render target ( or a given texture )

arguments.name: rendertarget
arguments.description: The texture to blur

arguments.name: blurx
arguments.description: Horizontal amount of blur

arguments.name: blury
arguments.description: Vertical amount of blur

arguments.name: passes
arguments.description: Amount of passes to go through

functions.name: BrushMaterialOverride
functions.description: This function overrides the brush material for next render operations. It can be used with <page>Entity:DrawModel</page>.

functions.name: Capture
functions.description:
Captures a part of the current render target and returns the data as a binary string in the given format.

Since the pixel buffer clears itself every frame, this will return a black screen outside of . To capture the user's final view, use <page>GM:PostRender</page>. This will not capture the Steam overlay or third-party injections (such as the Discord overlay, Overwolf, and advanced cheats) on the user's screen.

<bug issue="2571">This sets the alpha channel incorrectly in PNG mode, causing the foreground to be rendered almost completely transparent.</bug>

arguments.name: captureData
arguments.description: Parameters of the capture. See <page>Structures/RenderCaptureData</page>.

functions.name: CapturePixels
functions.description: Dumps the current render target and allows the pixels to be accessed by <page>render.ReadPixel</page>.

functions.name: Clear
functions.description:
Clears the current render target and the specified buffers.

<bug issue="2085">This sets the alpha incorrectly for <page>surface</page> draw calls for render targets.</bug>

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: Red component to clear to.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: Green component to clear to.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: Blue component to clear to.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: Alpha component to clear to.

arguments.name: clearDepth
arguments.description: Clear the depth.

arguments.name: clearStencil
arguments.description: Clear the stencil.

functions.name: ClearBuffersObeyStencil
functions.description: Clears the current rendertarget for obeying the current stencil buffer conditions.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: Value of the red channel to clear the current rt with.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: Value of the green channel to clear the current rt with.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: Value of the blue channel to clear the current rt with.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: Value of the alpha channel to clear the current rt with.

arguments.name: depth
arguments.description: Clear the depth buffer.

functions.name: ClearDepth
functions.description:
Resets the depth buffer.

<bug issue="3317">This function also clears the stencil buffer. Use <page>render.Clear</page> in the meantime.</bug>

functions.name: ClearRenderTarget
functions.description:
Clears a render target

It uses <page>render.Clear</page> then <page>render.SetRenderTarget</page> on the modified render target.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color, see <page>Color</page>

functions.name: ClearStencil
functions.description: Resets all values in the stencil buffer to zero.

functions.name: ClearStencilBufferRectangle
functions.description:
Sets the stencil value in a specified rect.

This is **not** affected by <page>render.SetStencilWriteMask</page>

arguments.name: originX
arguments.description: X origin of the rectangle.

arguments.name: originY
arguments.description: Y origin of the rectangle.

arguments.name: endX
arguments.description: The end X coordinate of the rectangle.

arguments.name: endY
arguments.description: The end Y coordinate of the rectangle.

arguments.name: stencilValue
arguments.description: Value to set cleared stencil buffer to.

functions.name: ComputeDynamicLighting
functions.description: Calculates the lighting caused by dynamic lights for the specified surface.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position to sample from.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The normal of the surface.

returnValues.description: A vector representing the light at that point.

functions.name: ComputeLighting
functions.description: Calculates the light color of a certain surface.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position of the surface to get the light from.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The normal of the surface to get the light from.

returnValues.description: A vector representing the light at that point.

functions.name: CopyRenderTargetToTexture
functions.description: Copies the currently active Render Target to the specified texture.

arguments.name: Target
arguments.description: The texture to copy to

functions.name: CopyTexture
functions.description: Copies the contents of one texture to another. Only works with rendertargets.

functions.name: CullMode
functions.description: Changes the cull mode.

arguments.name: cullMode
arguments.description: Cullmode, see <page>Enums/MATERIAL_CULLMODE</page>

functions.name: DepthRange
functions.description: Set's the depth range of the upcoming render.

arguments.name: depthmin
arguments.description: The minimum depth of the upcoming render. 0.0 = render normally; 1.0 = render nothing

arguments.name: depthmax
arguments.description: The maximum depth of the upcoming render. 0.0 = render everything (through walls); 1.0 = render normally

functions.name: DrawBeam
functions.description:
Draws textured beam.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: Beam start position.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: Beam end position.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the beam.

arguments.name: textureStart
arguments.description: The start coordinate of the texture used.

arguments.name: textureEnd
arguments.description: The end coordinate of the texture used.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to be used. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: DrawBox
functions.description:
Draws a box in 3D space.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Origin of the box.

arguments.name: angles
arguments.description: Orientation of the box.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: Start position of the box, relative to origin.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: End position of the box, relative to origin.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the box. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: DrawLine
functions.description:
Draws a line in 3D space.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: Line start position in world coordinates.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: Line end position in world coordinates.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to be used. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: writeZ
arguments.description:
Whether or not to consider the Z buffer. If false, the line will be drawn over everything currently drawn, if true, the line will be drawn with depth considered, as if it were a regular object in 3D space.

<bug issue="1086">Enabling this option will cause the line to ignore the color's alpha.</bug>

functions.name: DrawQuad
functions.description:
Draws 2 connected triangles. Expects material to be set by <page>render.SetMaterial</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: vert1
arguments.description: First vertex.

arguments.name: vert2
arguments.description: The second vertex.

arguments.name: vert3
arguments.description: The third vertex.

arguments.name: vert4
arguments.description: The fourth vertex.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the quad. See <page>Global.Color</page>

functions.name: DrawQuadEasy
functions.description:
Draws a quad.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Origin of the sprite.

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The face direction of the quad.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the quad.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the quad.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the quad. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: The rotation of the quad counter-clockwise in degrees around the normal axis. In other words, the quad will always face the same way but this will rotate its corners.

functions.name: DrawScreenQuad
functions.description:
Draws the current material set by <page>render.SetMaterial</page> to the whole screen. The color cannot be customized.

See also <page>render.DrawScreenQuadEx</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

functions.name: DrawScreenQuadEx
functions.description:
Draws the the current material set by <page>render.SetMaterial</page> to the area specified. Color cannot be customized.

See also <page>render.DrawScreenQuad</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: startX
arguments.description: X start position of the rect.

arguments.name: startY
arguments.description: Y start position of the rect.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Width of the rect.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Height of the rect.

functions.name: DrawSphere
functions.description:
Draws a sphere in 3D space. The material previously set with <page>render.SetMaterial</page> will be applied the sphere's surface.

See also <page>render.DrawWireframeSphere</page> for a wireframe equivalent.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Position of the sphere.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: Radius of the sphere. Negative radius will make the sphere render inwards rather than outwards.

arguments.name: longitudeSteps
arguments.description: The number of longitude steps. This controls the quality of the sphere. Higher quality will lower performance significantly. 50 is a good number to start with.

arguments.name: latitudeSteps
arguments.description: The number of latitude steps. This controls the quality of the sphere. Higher quality will lower performance significantly. 50 is a good number to start with.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the sphere. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: DrawSprite
functions.description:
Draws a sprite in 3D space.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Position of the sprite.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Width of the sprite.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Height of the sprite.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Color of the sprite. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: DrawTextureToScreen
functions.description:
Draws a texture over the whole screen.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: tex
arguments.description: The texture to draw

functions.name: DrawTextureToScreenRect
functions.description:
Draws a textured rectangle.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: tex
arguments.description: The texture to draw

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate of the rectangle to draw.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate of the rectangle to draw.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the rectangle to draw.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the rectangle to draw.

functions.name: DrawWireframeBox
functions.description:
Draws a wireframe box in 3D space.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Position of the box.

arguments.name: angle
arguments.description: Angles of the box.

arguments.name: mins
arguments.description: The lowest corner of the box.

arguments.name: maxs
arguments.description: The highest corner of the box.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the box. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: writeZ
arguments.description: Sets whenever to write to the zBuffer.

functions.name: DrawWireframeSphere
functions.description:
Draws a wireframe sphere in 3d space.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: Position of the sphere.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The size of the sphere.

arguments.name: longitudeSteps
arguments.description:
The amount of longitude steps.
The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is.

arguments.name: latitudeSteps
arguments.description:
The amount of latitude steps.
The larger this number is, the smoother the sphere is.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color of the wireframe. Uses the <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: writeZ
arguments.description: Whether or not to consider the Z buffer. If false, the wireframe will be drawn over everything currently drawn. If true, it will be drawn with depth considered, as if it were a regular object in 3D space.

functions.name: EnableClipping
functions.description:
Sets the status of the clip renderer, returning previous state.

<warning>To prevent unintended rendering behavior of other mods/the game, you must reset the clipping state to its previous value.</warning>

<bug issue="3105">Reloading the map does not reset the previous value of this function.</bug>

arguments.name: state
arguments.description: New clipping state.

functions.name: EndBeam
functions.description: Ends the beam mesh of a beam started with <page>render.StartBeam</page>.

functions.name: FogColor
functions.description: Sets the color of the fog.

arguments.name: red
arguments.description: Red channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

arguments.name: green
arguments.description: Green channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

arguments.name: blue
arguments.description: Blue channel of the fog color, 0 - 255.

functions.name: FogEnd
functions.description: Sets the at which the fog reaches its max density.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description:
The distance at which the fog reaches its max density.

<note>If used in <page>GM:SetupSkyboxFog</page>, this value **must** be scaled by the first argument of the hook</note>

functions.name: FogMaxDensity
functions.description: Sets the maximum density of the fog.

arguments.name: maxDensity
arguments.description: The maximum density of the fog, 0-1.

functions.name: FogMode
functions.description: Sets the mode of fog.

arguments.name: fogMode
arguments.description: Fog mode, see <page>Enums/MATERIAL_FOG</page>.

functions.name: FogStart
functions.description: Sets the distance at which the fog starts showing up.

arguments.name: fogStart
arguments.description:
The distance at which the fog starts showing up.
<note>If used in <page>GM:SetupSkyboxFog</page>, this value **must** be scaled by the first argument of the hook</note>

functions.name: GetAmbientLightColor
functions.description: Returns the ambient color of the map.

functions.name: GetBlend
functions.description: Returns the current alpha blending.

functions.name: GetColorModulation
functions.description: Returns the current color modulation values as normals.

functions.name: GetDXLevel
functions.description: Returns the maximum available directX version.

functions.name: GetFogColor
functions.description: Returns the current fog color.

functions.name: GetFogDistances
functions.description: Returns the fog start and end distance.

functions.name: GetFogMode
functions.description: Returns the fog mode.

functions.name: GetFullScreenDepthTexture
functions.description: Returns the _rt_FullFrameDepth texture. Alias of _rt_PowerOfTwoFB

functions.name: GetLightColor
functions.description: Gets the light exposure on the specified position.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position of the surface to get the light from.

functions.name: GetPowerOfTwoTexture
functions.description: Returns the render target's power of two texture.

returnValues.description: The power of two texture, which is **_rt_poweroftwofb** by default.

functions.name: GetRefractTexture
functions.description: Alias of <page>render.GetPowerOfTwoTexture</page>.

functions.name: GetRenderTarget
functions.description:
Returns the currently active render target.

Instead of saving the current render target using this function and restoring to it later, it is generally better practice to use <page>render.PushRenderTarget</page> and <page>render.PopRenderTarget</page>.

functions.name: GetResolvedFullFrameDepth
functions.description: Returns the _rt_ResolvedFullFrameDepth texture for SSAO depth.

functions.name: GetScreenEffectTexture
functions.description:
Obtain an <page>ITexture</page> of the screen. You must call <page>render.UpdateScreenEffectTexture</page> in order to update this texture with the currently rendered scene.

This texture is mainly used within <page>GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects</page>

arguments.name: textureIndex
arguments.description: Max index is 3, but engine only creates the first two for you.

functions.name: GetSuperFPTex
functions.description:
Returns a floating point texture the same resolution as the screen.

<note>The <page>gmodscreenspace</page> doesn't behave as expected when drawing a floating-point texture to an integer texture (e.g. the default render target). Use an UnlitGeneric material instead</note>

functions.name: GetSuperFPTex2
functions.description: See <page>render.GetSuperFPTex</page>

functions.name: GetSurfaceColor
functions.description: Performs a render trace and returns the color of the surface hit, this uses a low res version of the texture.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The start position to trace from.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The end position of the trace.

functions.name: GetToneMappingScaleLinear
functions.description: Returns a vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

returnValues.description: The vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

functions.name: MaterialOverride
functions.description: Sets the render material override for all next calls of <page>Entity:DrawModel</page>. Also overrides <page>render.MaterialOverrideByIndex</page>.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material to use as override, use nil to disable.

functions.name: MaterialOverrideByIndex
functions.description:
Similar to <page>render.MaterialOverride</page>, but overrides the materials per index.

<page>render.MaterialOverride</page> overrides effects of this function.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: Starts with 0, the index of the material to override

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material to override with

functions.name: MaxTextureHeight
functions.description: Returns the maximum texture height the renderer can handle.

functions.name: MaxTextureWidth
functions.description: Returns the maximum texture width the renderer can handle.

functions.name: Model
functions.description:
Creates a new <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page>, renders it at the specified pos/ang, and removes it. Can also be given an existing <page>CSEnt</page> to reuse instead.

<note>This function is only meant to be used in a single render pass kind of scenario, if you need to render a model continuously, use a cached <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page> and provide it as a second argument.</note>

<bug issue="3307">Using this with a map model (<page>game.GetWorld</page>():<page text="GetModel">Entity:GetModel</page>()) crashes the game.</bug>

arguments.name: settings
arguments.description:
Requires:
* <page>string</page> model - The model to draw
* <page>Vector</page> pos - The position to draw the model at
* <page>Angle</page> angle - The angles to draw the model at

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: If provided, this entity will be reused instead of creating a new one with <page>Global.ClientsideModel</page>. Note that the ent's model, position and angles will be changed, and <page>Entity:SetNoDraw</page> will be set to true.

functions.name: ModelMaterialOverride
functions.description: Sets a material to override a model's default material. Similar to <page>Entity:SetMaterial</page> except it uses an <page>IMaterial</page> argument and it can be used to change materials on models which are part of the world geometry.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material override.

functions.name: OverrideAlphaWriteEnable
functions.description:
Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the alpha channel of the current render target.

See also <page>render.OverrideBlend</page>.

<note>Doing <page>surface</page> draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and will never have any effect.</note>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the override.

arguments.name: shouldWrite
arguments.description: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the alpha channel or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

functions.name: OverrideBlend
functions.description:
Overrides the internal graphical functions used to determine the final color and alpha of a rendered texture.

See also <page>render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable</page>.

<note>Doing <page>surface</page> draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and won't have an effect.</note>

arguments.name: enabled
arguments.description: true to enable, false to disable. No other arguments are required when disabling.

arguments.name: srcBlend
arguments.description: The source color blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>. Determines how a rendered texture's final color should be calculated.

arguments.name: destBlend
arguments.description: The destination color blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>.

arguments.name: blendFunc
arguments.description: The blend mode used for drawing the color layer <page>Enums/BLENDFUNC</page>.

arguments.name: srcBlendAlpha
arguments.description: The source alpha blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>. Determines how a rendered texture's final alpha should be calculated.

arguments.name: destBlendAlpha
arguments.description: The destination alpha blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>.

arguments.name: blendFuncAlpha
arguments.description: The blend mode used for drawing the alpha layer <page>Enums/BLENDFUNC</page>.

functions.name: OverrideBlendFunc
functions.description:
<deprecated>Use <page>render.OverrideBlend</page> instead.</deprecated>

Overrides the internal graphical functions used to determine the final color and alpha of a rendered texture.

See also <page>render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable</page>.

<note>Doing <page>surface</page> draw calls with alpha set to 0 is a no-op and will never have any effect.</note>

arguments.name: enabled
arguments.description: true to enable, false to disable. No other arguments are required when disabling.

arguments.name: srcBlend
arguments.description: The source color blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>. Determines how a rendered texture's final color should be calculated.

arguments.name: srcBlendAlpha
arguments.description: The source alpha blend function <page>Enums/BLEND</page>. Determines how a rendered texture's final alpha should be calculated.

functions.name: OverrideColorWriteEnable
functions.description: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the color channel of the current render target.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the override.

arguments.name: shouldWrite
arguments.description: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the color channel or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

functions.name: OverrideDepthEnable
functions.description: Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the depth buffer.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the override.

arguments.name: shouldWrite
arguments.description: If the previous argument is true, sets whether the next rendering operations should write to the depth buffer or not. Has no effect if the previous argument is false.

functions.name: PopCustomClipPlane
functions.description: Removes the current active clipping plane from the clip plane stack.

functions.name: PopFilterMag
functions.description:
Pops the current texture magnification filter from the filter stack.

See <page>render.PushFilterMag</page>

functions.name: PopFilterMin
functions.description:
Pops the current texture minification filter from the filter stack.

See <page>render.PushFilterMin</page>

functions.name: PopFlashlightMode
functions.description: Pops the current flashlight mode from the flashlight mode stack.

functions.name: PopRenderTarget
functions.description:
Pops the last render target and viewport from the RT stack and sets them as the current render target and viewport.

This is should be called to restore the previous render target and viewport after a call to <page>render.PushRenderTarget</page>.

functions.name: PushCustomClipPlane
functions.description:
Pushes a new clipping plane of the clip plane stack and sets it as active.

<note>A max of 2 clip planes are supported on Linux/POSIX, and 6 on Windows.</note>

arguments.name: normal
arguments.description: The normal of the clipping plane.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance of the plane from the world origin. You can use <page>Vector:Dot</page> between the normal and any point on the plane to find this.

functions.name: PushFilterMag
functions.description: Pushes a texture filter onto the magnification texture filter stack.

arguments.name: texFilterType
arguments.description: The texture filter type, see <page>Enums/TEXFILTER</page>

functions.name: PushFilterMin
functions.description: Pushes a texture filter onto the minification texture filter stack.

arguments.name: texFilterType
arguments.description: The texture filter type, see <page>Enums/TEXFILTER</page>

functions.name: PushFlashlightMode
functions.description:
Enables the flashlight projection for the upcoming rendering.

<bug issue="3029">This will leave models lit under specific conditions.</bug>

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Whether the flashlight mode should be enabled or disabled.

functions.name: PushRenderTarget
functions.description:
Pushes the current render target and viewport to the RT stack then sets a new current render target and viewport. If the viewport is not specified, the dimensions of the render target are used instead.

This is similar to a call to <page>render.SetRenderTarget</page> and <page>render.SetViewPort</page> where the current render target and viewport have been saved beforehand, except the viewport isn't clipped to screen bounds.

See also <page>render.PopRenderTarget</page>.

<note>If you want to render to the render target in 2d mode and it is not the same size as the screen, use <page>cam.Start2D</page> and <page>cam.End2D</page>.</note>
<note>If the render target is bigger than the screen, rendering done with the surface library will be clipped to the screen bounds unless you call <page>Global.DisableClipping</page></note>

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The new render target to be used.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X origin of the viewport.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y origin of the viewport.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the viewport.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the viewport

functions.name: ReadPixel
functions.description: Reads the color of the specified pixel from the RenderTarget sent by <page>render.CapturePixels</page>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate.

functions.name: RedownloadAllLightmaps
functions.description: This applies the changes made to map lighting using <page>engine.LightStyle</page>.

arguments.name: DoStaticProps
arguments.description: When true, this will also apply lighting changes to static props. This is really slow on large maps.

functions.name: RenderHUD
functions.description: Renders the HUD on the screen.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X position for the HUD draw origin.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y position for the HUD draw origin.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the HUD draw.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the HUD draw.

functions.name: RenderView
functions.description:
Renders the scene with the specified viewData to the current active render target.

<bug issue="1330">Static props and LODs are rendered improperly due to incorrectly perceived distance.</bug>

arguments.name: view
arguments.description: The view data to be used in the rendering. See <page>Structures/ViewData</page>. Any missing value is assumed to be that of the current view. Similarly, you can make a normal render by simply not passing this table at all.

functions.name: ResetModelLighting
functions.description:
Resets the model lighting to the specified color.

Calls <page>render.SetModelLighting</page> for every direction with given color.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red part of the color, 0-1

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green part of the color, 0-1

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue part of the color, 0-1

functions.name: ResetToneMappingScale
functions.description:
Resets the HDR tone multiplier to the specified value.

This will only work on HDR maps, and the value will automatically fade to what it was ( or whatever <page>render.SetGoalToneMappingScale</page> is ) if called only once.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: The value which should be used as multiplier.

functions.name: SetAmbientLight
functions.description: Sets the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red part of the color, 0-1.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green part of the color, 0-1.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue part of the color, 0-1.

functions.name: SetBlend
functions.description:
Sets the alpha blending for every upcoming render operation.

<bug issue="3166">This does not affect non-model render.Draw* functions.</bug>

arguments.name: blending
arguments.description: Blending value from 0-1.

functions.name: SetColorMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the current drawing material to "color".

The material is defined as:
```

"UnlitGeneric"
{
"$basetexture" "color/white"
"$model" 		1
"$translucent" 	1
"$vertexalpha" 	1
"$vertexcolor" 	1
}
```

functions.name: SetColorMaterialIgnoreZ
functions.description:
Sets the current drawing material to "color_ignorez".

The material is defined as:
```

"UnlitGeneric"
{
"$basetexture" "color/white"
"$model" 		1
"$translucent" 	1
"$vertexalpha" 	1
"$vertexcolor" 	1
"$ignorez"		1
}
```

functions.name: SetColorModulation
functions.description: Sets the color modulation.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue channel multiplier normal ranging from 0-1.

functions.name: SetFogZ
functions.description: If the fog mode is set to <page text="MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z">Enums/MATERIAL_FOG</page>, the fog will only be rendered below the specified height.

arguments.name: fogZ
arguments.description: The fog Z.

functions.name: SetGoalToneMappingScale
functions.description:
Sets the goal HDR tone mapping scale.

Use this in a rendering/think hook as it is reset every frame.

arguments.name: scale
arguments.description: The target scale.

functions.name: SetLightingMode
functions.description:
Sets lighting mode when rendering something.

<note>**Do not forget to restore the default value** to avoid unexpected behavior, like the world and the HUD/UI being affected</note>

arguments.name: Mode
arguments.description:
Lighting render mode

Possible values are:
* 0 - Default
* 1 - Total fullbright, similar to `mat_fullbright 1` but excluding some weapon view models
* 2 - Increased brightness(?), models look fullbright

functions.name: SetLightingOrigin
functions.description:
Sets the lighting origin.

<bug issue="2804">This does not work for prop_physics.</bug>

arguments.name: lightingOrigin
arguments.description: The position from which the light should be "emitted".

functions.name: SetLightmapTexture
functions.description:
Sets the texture to be used as the lightmap in upcoming rendering operations. This is required when rendering meshes using a material with a lightmapped shader such as LightmappedGeneric.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>
<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: tex
arguments.description: The texture to be used as the lightmap.

functions.name: SetLocalModelLights
functions.description:
Sets up the local lighting for any upcoming render operation. Up to 4 local lights can be defined, with one of three different types (point, directional, spot).

Disables all local lights if called with no arguments.

arguments.name: lights
arguments.description: A table containing up to 4 tables for each light source that should be set up. Each of these tables should contain the properties of its associated light source, see <page>Structures/LocalLight</page>.

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the material to be used in any upcoming render operation using the <page>render</page>.

Not to be confused with <page>surface.SetMaterial</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>
<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: mat
arguments.description: The material to be used.

functions.name: SetModelLighting
functions.description:
Sets up the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation. Ambient lighting can be seen as a cube enclosing the object to be drawn, each of its faces representing a directional light source that shines towards the object. Thus, there is a total of six different light sources that can be configured separately.

Light color components are not restricted to a specific range (i.e. 0-255), instead, higher values will result in a brighter light.

arguments.name: lightDirection
arguments.description: The light source to edit, see <page>Enums/BOX</page>.

arguments.name: red
arguments.description: The red component of the light color.

arguments.name: green
arguments.description: The green component of the light color.

arguments.name: blue
arguments.description: The blue component of the light color.

functions.name: SetRenderTarget
functions.description: Sets the render target to the specified rt.

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The new render target to be used.

functions.name: SetRenderTargetEx
functions.description: Sets the render target with the specified index to the specified rt.

arguments.name: rtIndex
arguments.description: The index of the rt to set.

arguments.name: texture
arguments.description: The new render target to be used.

functions.name: SetScissorRect
functions.description: Sets a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.

arguments.name: startX
arguments.description: X start coordinate of the scissor rect.

arguments.name: startY
arguments.description: Y start coordinate of the scissor rect.

arguments.name: endX
arguments.description: X end coordinate of the scissor rect.

arguments.name: endY
arguments.description: Y end coordinate of the scissor rect.

arguments.name: enable
arguments.description: Enable or disable the scissor rect.

functions.name: SetShadowColor
functions.description: Sets the shadow color.

arguments.name: red
arguments.description: The red channel of the shadow color.

arguments.name: green
arguments.description: The green channel of the shadow color.

arguments.name: blue
arguments.description: The blue channel of the shadow color.

functions.name: SetShadowDirection
functions.description: Sets the shadow projection direction.

arguments.name: shadowDirections
arguments.description: The new shadow direction.

functions.name: SetShadowDistance
functions.description: Sets the maximum shadow projection range.

arguments.name: shadowDistance
arguments.description: The new maximum shadow distance.

functions.name: SetShadowsDisabled
functions.description: Sets whether any future render operations will ignore shadow drawing.

functions.name: SetStencilCompareFunction
functions.description:
Sets the compare function of the stencil.

Pixels which fail the stencil comparison function are not written to the render target. The operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values for these pixels can be set using <page>render.SetStencilFailOperation</page>.

Pixels which pass the stencil comparison function are written to the render target unless they fail the depth buffer test (where applicable). The operation to perform on the stencil buffer values for these pixels can be set using <page>render.SetStencilPassOperation</page> and <page>render.SetStencilZFailOperation</page>.

arguments.name: compareFunction
arguments.description: Compare function, see <page>Enums/STENCILCOMPARISONFUNCTION</page>, and <page>Enums/STENCIL</page> for short.

functions.name: SetStencilEnable
functions.description:
Sets whether stencil tests are carried out for each rendered pixel.

Only pixels passing the stencil test are written to the render target.

arguments.name: newState
arguments.description: The new state.

functions.name: SetStencilFailOperation
functions.description:
Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was not successful.
Note that this takes place **before** depth testing.

arguments.name: failOperation
arguments.description: Fail operation function, see <page>Enums/STENCILOPERATION</page>

functions.name: SetStencilPassOperation
functions.description: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was successful.

arguments.name: passOperation
arguments.description: Pass operation function, see <page>Enums/STENCILOPERATION</page>

functions.name: SetStencilReferenceValue
functions.description: Sets the reference value which will be used for all stencil operations. This is an unsigned integer.

arguments.name: referenceValue
arguments.description: Reference value.

functions.name: SetStencilTestMask
functions.description: Sets the unsigned 8-bit test bitflag mask to be used for any stencil testing.

arguments.name: mask
arguments.description: The mask bitflag.

functions.name: SetStencilWriteMask
functions.description: Sets the unsigned 8-bit write bitflag mask to be used for any writes to the stencil buffer.

arguments.name: mask
arguments.description: The mask bitflag.

functions.name: SetStencilZFailOperation
functions.description: Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the stencil test is passed but the depth buffer test fails.

arguments.name: zFailOperation
arguments.description: Z fail operation function, see <page>Enums/STENCILOPERATION</page>

functions.name: SetViewPort
functions.description:
Changes the view port position and size. The values will be clamped to the game's screen resolution.

If you are looking to render something to a texture (render target), you should use <page>render.PushRenderTarget</page>.

<note>This function will override values of <page>Global.ScrW</page> and <page>Global.ScrH</page> with the ones you set.</note>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: X origin of the view port.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: Y origin of the view port.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: Width of the view port.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: Height of the view port.

functions.name: SetWriteDepthToDestAlpha
functions.description: Sets the internal parameter **INT_RENDERPARM_WRITE_DEPTH_TO_DESTALPHA**

functions.name: Spin
functions.description:
Swaps the frame buffers/cycles the frame. In other words, this updates the screen.

If you take a really long time during a single frame render, it is a good idea to use this and let the user know that the game isn't stuck.

functions.name: StartBeam
functions.description:
Start a new beam draw operation.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="3D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: segmentCount
arguments.description: Amount of beam segments that are about to be drawn.

functions.name: SupportsHDR
functions.description: Returns whether the game supports HDR, i.e. if the DirectX level is higher than or equal to 8.

functions.name: SupportsPixelShaders_1_4
functions.description: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 1.4.

returnValues.description: Whether Pixel Shaders 1.4 are supported or not.

functions.name: SupportsPixelShaders_2_0
functions.description: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 2.0.

returnValues.description: Whether Pixel Shaders 2.0 are supported or not.

functions.name: SupportsVertexShaders_2_0
functions.description: Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of vertex shaders 2.0.

returnValues.description: Whether Vertex Shaders 2.0 are supported or not.

functions.name: SuppressEngineLighting
functions.description:
Suppresses or enables any engine lighting for any upcoming render operation.

<bug issue="4070">This does not affect <page>IMesh</page>es.</bug>

arguments.name: suppressLighting
arguments.description: True to suppress false to enable.

functions.name: TurnOnToneMapping
functions.description: Enables HDR tone mapping which influences the brightness.

functions.name: UpdateFullScreenDepthTexture
functions.description:
Updates the texture returned by <page>render.GetFullScreenDepthTexture</page>.

Silently fails if <page>render.SupportsPixelShaders_2_0</page> returns false.

functions.name: UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture
functions.description: Updates the power of two texture.

functions.name: UpdateRefractTexture
functions.description: Pretty much alias of <page>render.UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture</page> but does not return the texture.

functions.name: UpdateScreenEffectTexture
functions.description: Copies the entire screen to the screen effect texture, which can be acquired via <page>render.GetScreenEffectTexture</page>. This function is mainly intended to be used in <page>GM:RenderScreenspaceEffects</page>

name: resource
description: The resource library is used to control what files are sent to clients who join a server, this includes models, materials, sounds, text files but not Lua files.

functions.name: AddFile
functions.description:
Adds the specified and all related files to the files the client should download.

For convenience, this function will automatically add any other files that are related to the selected one, and throw an error if it can't find them. For example, a `.vmt` file will automatically add the `.vtf` with the same name, and a `.mdl` file will automatically add all `.vvd`, `.ani`, `.dx80.vtx`, `.dx90.vtx`, `.sw.vtx`, `.phy` and `.jpg` files with the same name, with a separate error for each missing file.

If you do not want it to do this, use <page>resource.AddSingleFile</page>.

<warning>There's a 8192 downloadable file limit. If you need more, consider using Workshop addons - <page>resource.AddWorkshop</page>. You should also consider the fact that you have way too many downloads. This limit is shared among all resource.Add functions.</warning>

<note>Running this function using a path relative to the main `garrysmod/` folder will not work for files in addons and gamemodes. Instead, the files must be added relative to their respective content folders. For example, a sound file from an addon would use the path "sound/[FILENAME_AND_EXTENSION]," despite the file being located in "addons/[ADDON_NAME]/sound/[FILENAME_AND_EXTENSION]"</note>

<note>The file must exist on the server or players will not download it!</note>

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: Virtual path of the file to be added, relative to `garrysmod/`. Do not add `.bz2` to the filepath. Do not put `gamemodes/*gamemodename*/content/` or `addons/<*addonname*/` into the path.

functions.name: AddSingleFile
functions.description:
Adds the specified file to the files the client should download.

If you wish to add textures or models, consider using <page>resource.AddFile</page> to add all the files required for a texture/model.

<warning>There's a 8192 downloadable file limit. </warning>
<note>If you need more than 8192, consider using Workshop addons - <page>resource.AddWorkshop</page>. You should also consider the fact that you have way too many downloads. This limit is shared among all resource.Add functions.</note>

<note>The file must exist on the server or players will not download it!</note>

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: Path of the file to be added, relative to garrysmod/

functions.name: AddWorkshop
functions.description:
Adds a workshop addon for the client to download before entering the server. Having the raw files from a workshop item does not count as having already downloaded it.
So players who previously downloaded a map through Fast Download will have to re-download it if you use the workshop. You should try to only add addons that have custom content ( models, sounds, etc ). Gamemodes that are Gamemode_Creation#Gamemode_Text_File are automatically added to this list - so there's no need to add them. The server's current map is also automatically added, if it is loaded from a workshop addon. This will not "install" the addon on your server, see Workshop for Dedicated Servers for installing Steam Workshop addons onto your servers

arguments.name: workshopid
arguments.description: The workshop id of the file. This cannot be a collection.

name: saverestore
description: The saverestore library contains functions relating to the singleplayer save system built into the game.

functions.name: AddRestoreHook
functions.description: Adds a restore/load hook for the Half-Life 2 save system.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for this hook.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called when an engine save is being loaded. It has one argument:


<page>IRestore</page> save - The restore object to be used to read data from save file that is being loaded





You can also use those functions to read data:


<page>saverestore.ReadVar</page>


<page>saverestore.ReadTable</page>


<page>saverestore.LoadEntity</page>

functions.name: AddSaveHook
functions.description: Adds a save hook for the Half-Life 2 save system. You can this to carry data through level transitions in Half-Life 2.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for this hook.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called when an engine save is being saved. It has one argument:


<page>ISave</page> save - The save object to be used to write data to the save file that is being saved





You can also use those functions to save data:


<page>saverestore.WriteVar</page>


<page>saverestore.WriteTable</page>


<page>saverestore.SaveEntity</page>

functions.name: LoadEntity
functions.description: Loads <page>Entity:GetTable</page> from the save game file that is being loaded and merges it with the given entitys <page>Entity:GetTable</page>.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity which will receive the loaded values from the save.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The restore object to read the <page>Entity:GetTable</page> from.

functions.name: LoadGlobal
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by engine when a save is being loaded.

This handles loading gamemode and calls all of the hooks added with <page>saverestore.AddRestoreHook</page>.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The restore object to read data from the save file with.

functions.name: PreRestore
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by the engine just before <page>saverestore.LoadGlobal</page> is.

functions.name: PreSave
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by the engine just before <page>saverestore.SaveGlobal</page> is.

functions.name: ReadTable
functions.description: Reads a table from the save game file that is being loaded.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The restore object to read the table from.

returnValues.description: The table that has been read, if any

functions.name: ReadVar
functions.description:
Loads a variable from the save game file that is being loaded.

Variables will be read in the save order you have saved them.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The restore object to read variables from.

returnValues.description: The variable that was read, if any.

functions.name: SaveEntity
functions.description: Saves entitys <page>Entity:GetTable</page> to the save game file that is being saved.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: The entity to save <page>Entity:GetTable</page> of.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The save object to save <page>Entity:GetTable</page> to.

functions.name: SaveGlobal
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called by engine when a save is being saved.

This handles saving gamemode and calls all of the hooks added with <page>saverestore.AddSaveHook</page>.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The save object to write data into the save file.

functions.name: WritableKeysInTable
functions.description: Returns how many writable keys are in the given table.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table to test.

returnValues.description: The number of keys that can be written with <page>saverestore.WriteTable</page>.

functions.name: WriteTable
functions.description: Write a table to a save game file that is being saved.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table to write

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The save object to write the table to.

functions.name: WriteVar
functions.description: Writes a variable to the save game file that is being saved.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description:
The value to save.

It can be one of the following types: <page>number</page>, <page>boolean</page>, <page>string</page>, <page>Entity</page>, <page>Angle</page>, <page>Vector</page> or <page>table</page>.

arguments.name: save
arguments.description: The save object to write the variable to.

name: scripted_ents
description: The scripted_ents library allows you to access information about any scripted entities loaded into the game, as well as register your own entities.

functions.name: Alias
functions.description: Defines an alias string that can be used to refer to another classname

arguments.name: alias
arguments.description: A new string which can be used to refer to another classname

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: The classname the alias should refer to

functions.name: Get
functions.description: Returns a copy of the ENT table for a class, including functions defined by the base class

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: The classname of the ENT table to return, can be an alias

functions.name: GetList
functions.description: Returns a copy of the list of all ENT tables registered

returnValues.description:
A table of all entities in the following format: (table keys are the classnames)
* <page>table</page> t - The <page>ENT associated with the entity</page>
* <page>boolean</page> isBaseType - Always true
* <page>string</page> Base - The entity base (note capital B in the key name)
* <page>string</page> type - The entity type

functions.name: GetMember
functions.description: Retrieves a member of entity's table.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: Entity's class name

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of member to retrieve

returnValues.description: The member or nil if failed

functions.name: GetSpawnable
functions.description: Returns a list of all ENT tables which contain either ENT.Spawnable or ENT.AdminSpawnable

functions.name: GetStored
functions.description: Returns the actual ENT table for a class. Modifying functions/variables in this table will change newly spawned entities

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: The classname of the ENT table to return

functions.name: GetType
functions.description: Returns the 'type' of a class, this will one of the following: 'anim', 'ai', 'brush', 'point'.

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: The classname to check

functions.name: IsBasedOn
functions.description: Checks if name is based on base

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Entity's class name to be checked

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Base class name to be checked

returnValues.description: Returns true if class name is based on base, else false.

functions.name: OnLoaded
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called after all ENTS have been loaded and runs <page>baseclass.Set</page> on each one.

You can retrieve all the currently registered ENTS with <page>scripted_ents.GetList</page>.

<note>This is not called after an ENT auto refresh, and thus the inherited baseclass functions retrieved with <page>baseclass.Get</page> will not be updated</note>

functions.name: Register
functions.description:
Registers an ENT table with a classname. Reregistering an existing classname will automatically update the functions of all existing entities of that class.

<bug pull="1300">Sub-tables provided in the first argument will not carry over their metatable, and will receive a BaseClass key if the table was merged with the base's. Userdata references, which includes Vectors, Angles, Entities, etc. will not be copied.</bug>

arguments.name: ENT
arguments.description: The ENT table to register

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: The classname to register

name: search
description: The search library

functions.name: AddProvider
functions.description: Adds a search result provider. For examples, see gamemodes/sandbox/gamemode/cl_search_models.lua

arguments.name: provider
arguments.description:
Provider function. It has one argument: <page>string</page> searchQuery
You must return a list of tables structured like this:
* <page>string</page> text - Text to "Copy to clipboard"
* <page>function</page> func - Function to use/spawn the item
* <page>Panel</page> icon - A panel to add to spawnmenu
* <page>table</page> words - A table of words?

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: If provided, ensures that only one provider exists with the given ID at a time.

functions.name: GetResults
functions.description: Retrieves search results.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: Search query

arguments.name: types
arguments.description: If set, only searches given provider type(s), instead of everything. For example `"tool"` will only search tools in Sandbox. Can be a table for multiple types.

arguments.name: maxResults
arguments.description: How many results to stop at

name: serverlist
description: Menu state library to query the master server list.

functions.name: AddCurrentServerToFavorites
functions.description: <internal></internal>Adds current server the player is on to their favorites.

functions.name: PlayerList
functions.description: Queries a server for its player list.

arguments.name: ip
arguments.description: The IP address of the server, including the port.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
The function to be called if and when the request finishes. Function has one argument, a table containing tables with player info.

Each table with player info has next fields:


<page>number</page> time - The amount of time the player is playing on the server, in seconds


<page>string</page> name - The player name


<page>number</page> score - The players score

functions.name: Query
functions.description: Queries the master server for server list.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The information about what kind of servers we want. See <page>Structures/ServerQueryData</page>.

name: sound
description: Used primarily for adding new soundscript entries.

functions.name: Add
functions.description: Creates a sound script. It can also override sounds, which seems to only work when set on the server.

arguments.name: soundData
arguments.description: The sounds properties. See <page>Structures/SoundData</page>

functions.name: AddSoundOverrides
functions.description: Overrides sounds defined inside of a txt file; typically used for adding map-specific sounds.

arguments.name: filepath
arguments.description: Path to the script file to load.

functions.name: Generate
functions.description:
Creates a sound from a function.

<bug issue="3360">This function cannot generate sounds that have a duration of less than 1 second.</bug>
<bug issue="4082">Sounds persist between disconnects.</bug>

arguments.name: indentifier
arguments.description:
An unique identified for the sound.

<warning>You cannot override already existing ones.</warning>

arguments.name: samplerate
arguments.description: The sample rate of the sound. Must be 11025, 22050 or 44100.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: The length in seconds of the sound to generate.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A function which will be called to generate every sample on the sound. This function gets the current sample number passed as the first argument. The return value must be between -1.0 and 1.0. Other values will wrap back to the -1 to 1 range and basically clip. There are 65535 possible quantifiable values between -1 and 1.

functions.name: GetProperties
functions.description: Returns properties of the soundscript.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the sound script

returnValues.description: The properties of the soundscript. See <page>Structures/SoundData</page>

functions.name: GetTable
functions.description: Returns a list of all registered sound scripts.

returnValues.description: The list/array of all registered sound scripts ( No other information is provided )

functions.name: Play
functions.description:
Plays a sound from the specified position in the world.
If you want to play a sound without a position, such as a UI sound, use <page>surface.PlaySound</page> instead.

arguments.name: Name
arguments.description: A string path to the sound.

arguments.name: Pos
arguments.description: A vector describing where the sound should play.

arguments.name: Level
arguments.description: Sound level in decibels. 75 is normal. Ranges from 20 to 180, where 180 is super loud. This affects how far away the sound will be heard.

arguments.name: Pitch
arguments.description: An integer describing the sound pitch. Range is from 0 to 255. 100 is normal pitch.

arguments.name: Volume
arguments.description: A float ranging from 0-1 describing the output volume of the sound.

functions.name: PlayFile
functions.description:
Plays a file from GMod directory. You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For external file/stream playback, see <page>sound.PlayURL</page>.

<bug issue="1752">This fails for looping .wav files in 3D mode.</bug>

<bug issue="2304">This fails with unicode file names.</bug>

arguments.name: path
arguments.description:
The path to the file to play.

Unlike other sound functions and structures, the path is relative to `garrysmod/` instead of `garrysmod/sound/`

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (" "):
* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position
* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel
* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called
* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for <page>IGModAudioChannel:SetTime</page>.




If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as "".

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded. It has next arguments:
* <page>IGModAudioChannel</page> soundchannel - The sound channel. Will be nil if an error occured.
* <page>number</page> errorID - ID of an error if an error has occured. Will be nil, otherwise.
* <page>string</page> errorName - Name of an error if an error has occured. Will be nil, otherwise.

functions.name: PlayURL
functions.description:
Allows you to play external sound files, as well as online radio streams.
You can find a list of all error codes [here](http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html)

For offline file playback, see <page>sound.PlayFile</page>.

<bug issue="2296">Due to a bug with [BASS](http://www.un4seen.com/), AAC codec streams cannot be played in 3D mode.</bug>

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: The URL of the sound to play

arguments.name: flags
arguments.description:
Flags for the sound. Can be one or more of following, separated by a space (" "):
* 3d - Makes the sound 3D, so you can set its position
* mono - Forces the sound to have only one channel
* noplay - Forces the sound not to play as soon as this function is called
* noblock - Disables streaming in blocks. It is more resource-intensive, but it is required for <page>IGModAudioChannel:SetTime</page>.




If you don't want to use any of the above, you can just leave it as "".

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description:
Callback function that is called as soon as the the stream is loaded. It has next arguments:


<page>IGModAudioChannel</page> soundchannel - The sound channel


<page>number</page> errorID - ID of an error, if an error has occured


<page>string</page> errorName - Name of an error, if an error has occured

name: spawnmenu
description: The spawnmenu library is a set of functions that allow you to control the spawn (Q) menu.

functions.name: ActivateTool
functions.description: Activates a tool, opens context menu and brings up the tool gun.

arguments.name: tool
arguments.description: Tool class/file name

functions.name: ActivateToolPanel
functions.description: Activates tools context menu in specified tool tab.

arguments.name: tab
arguments.description: The tabID of the tab to open the context menu in

arguments.name: cp
arguments.description: The control panel to open

functions.name: ActiveControlPanel
functions.description: Returns currently opened control panel of a tool, post process effect or some other menu in spawnmenu.

returnValues.description: The currently opened control panel, if any.

functions.name: AddContentType
functions.description:
Registers a new content type that is saveable into spawnlists.
Created/called by <page>spawnmenu.CreateContentIcon</page>.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: An unique name of the content type.

arguments.name: constructor
arguments.description:
A function that is called whenever we need create a new panel for this content type.

It has two arguments:


<page>Panel</page> container - The container/parent of the new panel


<page>table</page> data - Data for the content type passed from <page>spawnmenu.CreateContentIcon</page>

functions.name: AddCreationTab
functions.description: Inserts a new tab into the CreationMenus table, which will be used by the creation menu to generate its tabs (Spawnlists, Weapons, Entities, etc.)

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: What text will appear on the tab (I.E Spawnlists).

arguments.name: function
arguments.description: The function called to generate the content of the tab.

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: Path to the material that will be used as an icon on the tab.

arguments.name: order
arguments.description: The order in which this tab should be shown relative to the other tabs on the creation menu.

arguments.name: tooltip
arguments.description: The tooltip to be shown for this tab.

functions.name: AddPropCategory
functions.description:
Used to add addon spawnlists to the spawnmenu tree. This function should be called within <page>SANDBOX:PopulatePropMenu</page>.

Addon spawnlists will not save to disk if edited.

<warning>You should never try to modify player customized spawnlists!</warning>

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: A unique classname of the list.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the category displayed to the player, e.g. `Comic Props`.

arguments.name: contents
arguments.description:
A table of entries for the spawn menu. It must be numerically indexed. Each member of the table is a sub-table containing a type member, and other members depending on the type. | string type | Description | Other members | | ------------- | ---------- | ----------------- | | "header" | a simple header for organization | string text - The text that the header will display | | "model" | spawns a model where the player is looking | string model - The path to the model file
number skin - The skin for the model to use (optional)
string body - The bodygroups for the model (optional)
number wide - The width of the spawnicon (optional)
number tall - The height of the spawnicon (optional) | | "entity" | spawns an entity where the player is looking
(appears in the Entities tab by default) | string spawnname - The filename of the entity, for example "sent_ball"
string nicename - The name of the entity to display
string material - The icon to display, this should be set to "entities/.png"
boolean admin - Whether the entity is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "vehicle" | spawns a vehicle where the player is looking
(appears in the Vehicles tab by default) | string spawnname - The filename of the vehicle
string nicename - The name of the vehicle to display
string material - The icon to display
boolean admin - Whether the vehicle is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "npc" | spawns an NPC where the player is looking
(appears in the NPCs tab by default) | string spawnname - The spawn name of the NPC
string nicename - The name to display
string material - The icon to display
table weapon - A table of potential weapons (each a string) to give to the NPC.
When spawned, one of these will be chosen randomly each time.
boolean admin - Whether the NPC is only spawnable by admins (optional) | | "weapon" | When clicked, gives the player a weapon;
When middle-clicked, spawns a weapon where the player is looking
(appears in the Weapons tab by default) |string spawnname - The spawn name of the weapon
string nicename - The name to display
string material - The icon to display
boolean admin - Whether the weapon is only spawnable by admins (optional) |

arguments.name: icon
arguments.description: The icon to use in the tree.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The unique ID number for the spawnlist category. Used to make sub categories. See "parentID" parameter below. If not set, it will be automatically set to ever increasing number, starting with 1000.

arguments.name: parentID
arguments.description: The unique ID of the parent category. This will make the created category a subcategory of category with given unique ID. `0` makes this a base category (such as `Builder`).

arguments.name: needsApp
arguments.description: The needed game for this prop category, if one is needed. If the specified game is not mounted, the category isn't shown. This uses the shortcut name, e.g. `cstrike`, and not the Steam AppID.

You must call this function from <page>SANDBOX:AddToolMenuCategories</page> for it to work properly.

A function to build the context panel. The function has one argument:
* <page>Panel</page> pnl - A <page>DForm</page> that will be shown in the context menu

arguments.name: table

functions.name: AddToolTab

Adds a new tool tab to the right side of the spawnmenu via the <page>SANDBOX:AddToolMenuTabs</page> hook.

This function is a inferior duplicate of <page>spawnmenu.GetToolMenu</page>, just without its return value.

Seems to only work when ran at initialization.

returnValues.description: The created content icon, if it was returned by <page>spawnmenu.AddContentType</page>

<internal></internal>

functions.name: GetCustomPropTable
functions.description:
Similar to <page>spawnmenu.GetPropTable</page>, but only returns spawnlists created by addons via <page>spawnmenu.AddPropCategory</page>.

These spawnlists are shown in a separate menu in-game.

functions.name: GetPropTable
functions.description:
Returns a table of all prop categories and their props in the spawnmenu.

Note that if the spawnmenu has not been populated, this will return an empty table.

This will not return spawnlists created by addons, see  <page>spawnmenu.GetCustomPropTable</page> for that.

functions.name: GetToolMenu

returnValues.description: A table of tables representing categories and items in the left part of the tab. See example below to example structure.

returnValues.description: A table with groups of tools, along with information on each tool.

functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Calls <page>spawnmenu.PopulateFromTextFiles</page>.

functions.description: Loads spawnlists from text files.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: The function to call. Arguments are ( strFilename, strName, tabContents, icon, id, parentid, needsapp )

<internal></internal>

Saves a table of spawnlists to files.

<deprecated></deprecated>

Supposed to open specified tool tab in spawnmenu, in reality does nothing.

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The tab ID to open

name: sql
description:
The SQL library allows you to access powerful database software included with Garry's Mod. It is the preferred and fastest method of storing large amounts of data. The database is located in sv.db serverside and cl.db clientside, both in the Garry's Mod base folder. SQL is a whole scripting language in itself although relatively simple, it's something you'll need to read up on before using this library.

Known GMod SQL settings:
* No `ATTACH` and `DETACH` operations (`SQLITE_OMIT_ATTACH = 1`)
* No Virtual Tables (`SQLITE_OMIT_VIRTUALTABLE = 1`)
* Temp files are stored in memory (`SQLITE_TEMP_STORE = 3`)
* No `VACUUM` operation

functions.name: Begin
functions.description:
Tells the engine a set of queries is coming. Will wait until sql.Commit is called to run them.
This is most useful when you run more than 100+ queries.
This is equivalent to ``` sql.Query("BEGIN") ```

functions.name: Commit
functions.description:
Tells the engine to execute a series of queries queued for execution, must be preceded by <page>sql.Begin</page>

This is equivalent to `sql.Query("COMMIT")`.

functions.name: IndexExists
functions.description: Returns true if the index with the specified name exists.

arguments.name: indexName
arguments.description: The name of the index to check.

functions.name: LastError
functions.description: Returns the last error from a SQLite query.

functions.name: Query
functions.description: Performs a query on the local SQLite database, returns a table as result set, nil if result is empty and false on error.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The query to execute.

returnValues.description: false is returned if there is an error, nil if the query returned no data.

functions.name: QueryRow
functions.description:
Performs the query like <page>sql.Query</page>, but returns the first row found.

Basically equivalent to
```
sql.Query("*query* LIMIT 1")
```

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The input query

arguments.name: row
arguments.description: The row number. Say we receive back 5 rows, putting 3 as this argument will give us row #3.

functions.name: QueryValue
functions.description: Performs the query like <page>sql.QueryRow</page>, but returns the first value found.

arguments.name: query
arguments.description: The input query.

returnValues.description: The returned value; the engine automatically converts numerical output to Lua numbers.

functions.name: SQLStr
functions.description:
Escapes dangerous characters and symbols from user input used in an SQLite SQL Query.

<note>this function is not meant to be used with external database engines such as `MySQL`. Escaping strings with inadequate functions is dangerous!</note>

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string to be escaped.

arguments.name: bNoQuotes
arguments.description: Set this as true, and the function will not wrap the input string in apostrophes.

functions.name: TableExists
functions.description: Returns true if the table with the specified name exists.

arguments.name: tableName
arguments.description: The name of the table to check.

name: steamworks
description: Steamworks related functions.

Downloads a file from the supplied addon and saves it as a .cache file in garrysmod/cache folder.

This is mostly used to download the preview image of the addon, but the game seems to also use it to download replays and saves.

In case the retrieved file is an image and you need the <page>IMaterial</page>, use <page>Global.AddonMaterial</page> with the path supplied from the callback.

You will usually want to set this to true.

The second argument is a <page>File</page> object pointing to the downloaded .gma file. The file handle will be closed after the function exits.

Retrieves vote info of supplied addon.
