name: string
description:
The string *type* is a sequence of characters. The string *library* is a standard Lua library which provides functions for the manipulation of strings.[[1]](https://www.lua.org/pil/20.html) In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions and features added to this library.
Most notably all strings will access this library through the string metatable index function.[[2]](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/lua/includes/extensions/string.lua#L288-L299) This means all strings are treated like table objects and the string library as its Meta_Tables ```lua local x = "Kittens" function string.Foobar(self) return self:Right(4) end string.Right(x,4) == x:Right(4) == x:Foobar() == ("Kittens"):Right(4) == x[-4]..x[-3]..x[-2]..x[-1] ``` The string *metatable* however is something else, and to access that you must use `getmetatable("")`. The difference here is related to Metamethods, such as using (+) instead of (..) to concatenate strings. Using `+` operator for concatenation breaks lua metamethod to sum string as numbers (Example: `"10" + "1"` return `11` (number)) and this is 400 times SLOWER! ```lua local stringmeta = getmetatable("") function stringmeta.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- This will work function string.__add(str,x) return str..x end -- But this will not. print("Kittens" + " And " + "Puppies") ``` See Meta Tables and Metamethods for more information. Making changes to the string *metatable* is not a good idea unless you know what you are doing. Use the string *library* instead. This category lists functions available in the string *library*.

functions.name: byte
functions.description: Returns the given string's characters in their numeric ASCII representation.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string to get the chars from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The first character of the string to get the byte of.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The last character of the string to get the byte of.

functions.name: char
functions.description: Takes the given numerical bytes and converts them to a string.

arguments.name: bytes
arguments.description: The bytes to create the string from.

functions.name: Comma
functions.description: Inserts commas for every third digit.

arguments.name: InputNumber
arguments.description: The input number to commafy

functions.name: dump
functions.description:
Returns the binary bytecode of the given function.

<note>This does not work with functions created in C/C++. An error will be thrown if it is</note>

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to get the bytecode of

arguments.name: stripDebugInfo
arguments.description: True to strip the debug data, false to keep it

functions.name: EndsWith
functions.description: Returns whether or not the second passed string matches the end of the first.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string whose end is to be checked.

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: The string to be matched with the end of the first.

returnValues.description: `true` if the first string ends with the second, or the second is empty, otherwise `false`.

functions.name: Explode
functions.description:
Splits a string up wherever it finds the given separator.

This is the reverse of <page>string.Implode</page>.

arguments.name: separator
arguments.description: The string will be separated wherever this sequence is found.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string to split up.

arguments.name: use_patterns
arguments.description: Set this to true if your separator is a <page text="pattern">Patterns</page>.

returnValues.description: Exploded string as a numerical sequential table.

functions.name: find
functions.description: Attempts to find the specified substring in a string, uses <page>Patterns</page> by default.

arguments.name: haystack
arguments.description: The string to search in.

arguments.name: needle
arguments.description: The string to find, can contain patterns if enabled.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The position to start the search from, can be negative start position will be relative to the end position.

arguments.name: noPatterns
arguments.description: Disable patterns.

returnValues.description: Starting position of the found text, or nil if the text wasn't found
Ending position of found text, or nil if the text wasn't found
Matched text for each group if patterns are enabled and used, or nil if the text wasn't found

functions.name: format
functions.description: Formats the specified values into the string given.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description:
The string to be formatted.
Follows this format: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdio/printf/ LuaJIT supports all specifiers and doesn't support `*` width and `.*` presision. LuaJIT exclusives: | Format | Description | Example of the output | |:------:|:-----------:|:---------------------:| | %p | Returns pointer to supplied structure (table/function) | `0xf20a8968` | | %q | Formats a string between double quotes, using escape sequences when necessary to ensure that it can safely be read back by the Lua interpreter (last statement could be wrong) | `"test\1\2test"` |

arguments.name: formatParameters
arguments.description: Values to be formatted into the string.

functions.name: FormattedTime
functions.description: Returns the time as a formatted string or as a table if no format is given.

arguments.name: float
arguments.description: The time in seconds to format.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: An optional formatting to use. If no format it specified, a table will be returned instead.

returnValues.description:
Returns the time as a formatted string only if a format was specified.

Returns a table only if no format was specified. The table will contain these fields:
* <page>number</page> ms - milliseconds
* <page>number</page> s - seconds
* <page>number</page> m - minutes
* <page>number</page> h - hours

functions.name: FromColor
functions.description: Creates a string from a Color variable.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: The color to put in the string.

functions.name: GetChar
functions.description: <deprecated>Use either string.sub(str, index, index) or str[index].</deprecated> Returns char value from the specified index in the supplied string.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: The string that you will be searching with the supplied index.

arguments.name: index
arguments.description: The index's value of the string to be returned.

functions.name: GetExtensionFromFilename
functions.description: Returns extension of the file.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: String eg. file-path to get the file extensions from.

functions.name: GetFileFromFilename
functions.description: Returns file name and extension.

arguments.name: pathString
arguments.description: The string eg. file-path to get the file-name from.

functions.name: GetPathFromFilename
functions.description: Returns the path only from a file's path.

arguments.name: Inputstring
arguments.description: String to get path from.

functions.name: gfind
functions.description: <deprecated>This function is removed in Lua versions later than what GMod is currently using. Use <page>string.gmatch</page> instead.</deprecated>Returns an iterator function that is called for every complete match of the pattern, all sub matches will be passed as to the loop.

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: The string to search in

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.description: The pattern to search for

returnValues.description: The iterator function that can be used in a for-in loop

functions.name: gmatch
functions.description: Using <page>Patterns</page>, returns an iterator which will return either one value if no capture groups are defined, or any capture group matches.

functions.name: gsub
functions.description: This functions main purpose is to replace certain character sequences in a string using <page>Patterns</page>.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: String which should be modified.

arguments.name: pattern
arguments.description: The pattern that defines what should be matched and eventually be replaced.

arguments.name: replacement
arguments.description:
In case of a string the matches sequence will be replaced with it.

In case of a table, the matched sequence will be used as key and the table will tested for the key, if a value exists it will be used as replacement.

In case of a function all matches will be passed as parameters to the function, the return value(s) of the function will then be used as replacement.

arguments.name: maxReplaces
arguments.description: Maximum number of replacements to be made.

functions.name: Implode
functions.description:
<deprecated>You really should just use <page>table.concat</page>.</deprecated>

Joins the values of a table together to form a string.

This is the reverse of <page>string.Explode</page> and is functionally identical to <page>table.concat</page>, but with less features.

arguments.name: separator

arguments.name: pieces
arguments.description: The table of pieces to concatenate. The keys for these must be numeric and sequential.

name: surface
description: The surface library allows you to draw text and shapes on the screen. Primarily used for making HUDs & custom GUI panels.

functions.name: CreateFont
functions.description:
Creates a new font.

To prevent the font from displaying incorrectly when using the "outline" setting, set "antialias" to false. This will ensure the text properly fills out the entire outline.

Be sure to check the <page text="List of Default Fonts">Default_Fonts</page> first! Those fonts can be used without using this function.

See Also: <page>Finding the Font Name</page>.

<warning>Due to the static nature of fonts, do **NOT** create the font more than once. You should only be creating them once, it is recommended to create them at the top of your script. Do not use this function within <page>GM:HUDPaint</page> or any other hook!</warning>
<warning>Define fonts that you will actually use, as fonts are very taxing on performance and will cause crashes! Do not create fonts for every size.</warning>

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description: The new font name.

arguments.name: fontData
arguments.description: The font properties. See the <page>Structures/FontData</page>.

functions.name: DisableClipping
functions.description: Alias of Global.DisableClipping so use that instead. Enables or disables the clipping used by the VGUI that limits the drawing operations to a panels bounds. Identical to Global.DisableClipping. See also Panel:NoClipping.

arguments.name: disable
arguments.description: True to disable, false to enable the clipping

functions.name: DrawCircle
functions.description:
Draws a hollow circle, made of dots. For a filled circle, see examples for <page>surface.DrawPoly</page>.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: originX
arguments.description: The center x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: originY
arguments.description: The center y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: radius
arguments.description: The radius of the circle.

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of the color to draw the circle with, or a <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of the color to draw the circle with. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

functions.name: DrawLine
functions.description:
Draws a line from one point to another.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: startX
arguments.description: The start x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: startY
arguments.description: The start y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: endX
arguments.description: The end x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: endY
arguments.description: The end y integer coordinate.

functions.name: DrawOutlinedRect
functions.description:
Draws a hollow box with a border width of 1 px.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The start x integer coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The start y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: w
arguments.description: The integer width.

arguments.name: h
arguments.description: The integer height.

functions.name: DrawPoly
functions.description:
Draws a textured polygon (secretly a triangle fan) with a maximum of 256 vertices.
Only works properly with convex polygons. You may try to render concave polygons, but there is no guarantee that things wont get messed up.

Unlike most surface library functions, non-integer coordinates are not rounded.

<warning>You must reset the drawing color and texture before calling the function to ensure consistent results. See examples below.</warning>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: vertices
arguments.description:
A table containing integer vertices. See the <page>Structures/PolygonVertex</page>.

**The vertices must be in clockwise order.**

functions.name: DrawRect
functions.description:
Draws a solid rectangle on the screen.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

functions.name: DrawText
functions.description:
Draw the specified text on the screen, using the previously set position, font and color.

<note>This function does not handle newlines properly</note>
<note>This function sets new text position at the end of the previous drawn text length - this can be used to change text properties (such as font or color) without recalculating and resetting text position. See example #2 for example use of this behavior.</note>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text to be rendered.

functions.name: DrawTexturedRect
functions.description:
Draw a textured rectangle with the given position and dimensions on the screen, using the current active texture set with surface.SetMaterial. It is also affected by surface.SetDrawColor. See also render.SetMaterial and render.DrawScreenQuadEx.
See also surface.DrawTexturedRectUV.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

functions.name: DrawTexturedRectRotated
functions.description:
Draw a textured rotated rectangle with the given position and dimensions and angle on the screen, using the current active texture.

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate, representing the center of the rectangle.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate, representing the center of the rectangle.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: rotation
arguments.description: The rotation of the rectangle, in degrees.

functions.name: DrawTexturedRectUV
functions.description:
Draws a textured rectangle with a repeated or partial texture.

u and v refer to texture coordinates.
* (u, v) = (0, 0) is the top left
* (u, v) = (1, 0) is the top right
* (u, v) = (1, 1) is the bottom right
* (u, v) = (0, 1) is the bottom left

Using a start point of (1, 0) and an end point to (0, 1), you can draw an image flipped horizontally, same goes with other directions. Going above 1 will tile the texture. Negative values are allowed as well.

Here's a helper image:
<upload src="70c/8d7bba248dc08bd.png" size="183359" name="image.png">

<note>If you are using a .png image, you need supply the "noclamp" flag as second parameter for <page>Global.Material</page> if you intend to use tiling.</note>

<note>If you find that surface.DrawTexturedRectUV is getting your texture coordinates (u0, v0), (u1, v1) wrong and you're rendering with a material created with <page>Global.CreateMaterial</page>, try adjusting them with the following code:

```
local du = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection
local dv = 0.5 / 32 -- half pixel anticorrection
local u0, v0 = (u0 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v0 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)
local u1, v1 = (u1 - du) / (1 - 2 * du), (v1 - dv) / (1 - 2 * dv)
```


**Explanation:**
surface.DrawTexturedRectUV tries to correct the texture coordinates by half a pixel (something to do with sampling) and computes the correction using IMaterial::GetMappingWidth()/GetMappingHeight(). If the material was created without a $basetexture, then GetMappingWidth()/GetMappingHeight() uses the width and height of the error material (which is 32x32).</note>

<rendercontext hook="false" type="2D"></rendercontext>

<bug issue="3173">The UV offsets might require (sub-)pixel correction for accurate tiling results.</bug>
</upload>

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer coordinate.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The integer width of the rectangle.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The integer height of the rectangle.

arguments.name: startU
arguments.description: The U texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

arguments.name: startV
arguments.description: The V texture mapping of the rectangle origin.

arguments.name: endU
arguments.description: The U texture mapping of the rectangle end.

arguments.name: endV
arguments.description: The V texture mapping of the rectangle end.

functions.name: GetAlphaMultiplier
functions.description: Returns the current alpha multiplier affecting drawing operations.

functions.name: GetDrawColor
functions.description:
Returns the current color affecting draw operations.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: The color that drawing operations will use as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetHUDTexture
functions.description: Gets the [HUD icon](https://github.com/Facepunch/garrysmod/blob/master/garrysmod/scripts/hud_textures.txt) TextureID with the specified name.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the texture.

functions.name: GetTextColor
functions.description:
Returns the current color affecting text draw operations.

<bug issue="2407">The returned color will not have the color metatable.</bug>

returnValues.description: The color that text drawing operations will use as a <page>Color</page>.

functions.name: GetTextSize
functions.description: Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the given text, but only if the font has been set with <page>surface.SetFont</page>.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The string to check the size of.

functions.name: GetTextureID
functions.description:
Returns the texture id of the material with the given name/path.

<note>This function will not work with .png or .jpg images. For that, see <page>Global.Material</page></note>

arguments.name: name/path
arguments.description: Name or path of the texture.

functions.name: GetTextureSize
functions.description:
Returns the size of the texture with the associated texture ID.

For `.png/.jpg` textures loaded with <page>Global.Material</page> you can use the `$realheight` and `$realwidth` material parameters (<page>IMaterial:GetInt</page>) to get the size of the image.

arguments.name: textureID
arguments.description: The texture ID, returned by <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>.

functions.name: PlaySound
functions.description: Play a sound file directly on the client (such as UI sounds, etc).

arguments.name: soundfile
arguments.description: The path to the sound file, which must be relative to the sound/ folder.

functions.name: ScreenHeight
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Global.ScrH</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns the height of the current client's screen.

functions.name: ScreenWidth
functions.description:
<deprecated>You should use <page>Global.ScrW</page> instead.</deprecated>
Returns the width of the current client's screen.

functions.name: SetAlphaMultiplier
functions.description:
Sets the alpha multiplier that will influence all upcoming drawing operations.
See also <page>render.SetBlend</page>.

arguments.name: multiplier
arguments.description: The multiplier ranging from 0 to 1.

functions.name: SetDrawColor
functions.description:
Set the color of any future shapes to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate values or by a <page>Color</page>.

Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.

<note>Providing a <page>Color</page> structure is slower than providing four numbers. You may use <page>Color:Unpack</page> for this.</note>

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of color, or a <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of color. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of color. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of color. Unused if a <page>Color</page> was given.

functions.name: SetFont
functions.description:
Set the current font to be used for text operations later.

The fonts must first be created with <page>surface.CreateFont</page> or be one of the <page>Default Fonts</page>.

arguments.name: fontName
arguments.description: The name of the font to use.

functions.name: SetMaterial
functions.description:
Sets the material to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

Not to be confused with <page>render.SetMaterial</page>.

See also <page>surface.SetTexture</page>.

<warning><page>Global.Material</page> function calls are expensive to be done inside this function or inside rendering context, you should be caching the results of <page>Global.Material</page> calls</warning>
<note>When using <page>render.PushRenderTarget</page> or <page>render.SetRenderTarget</page>, `material` should have the `$ignorez` flag set to make it visible. If the material is not used in 3D rendering, it is probably safe to add it with this code:
```lua
material:SetInt( "$flags", bit.bor( material:GetInt( "$flags" ), 32768 ) )
```
</note>

arguments.name: material
arguments.description: The material to be used.

functions.name: SetTextColor
functions.description:
Set the color of any future text to be drawn, can be set by either using R, G, B, A as separate numbers or by a <page>Color</page>.

Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.
<note>Providing a <page>Color</page> structure is slower than providing four numbers. You may use <page>Color:Unpack</page> for this.</note>

arguments.name: r
arguments.description: The red value of color, or a <page>Color</page>.

arguments.name: g
arguments.description: The green value of color

arguments.name: b
arguments.description: The blue value of color

arguments.name: a
arguments.description: The alpha value of color

functions.name: SetTextPos
functions.description: Set the top-left position to draw any future text at.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X integer co-ordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y integer co-ordinate.

functions.name: SetTexture
functions.description:
Sets the texture to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

See also <page>surface.SetMaterial</page> for an <page>IMaterial</page> alternative.

arguments.name: textureID
arguments.description: The ID of the texture to draw with returned by <page>surface.GetTextureID</page>.

name: system
description: The system library provides functions that allow you to gather information about the system running the game, such as operating system, uptime and battery level.

functions.name: AppTime
functions.description:
Returns the total uptime of the current application as reported by Steam.

This will return a similar value to <page>Global.SysTime</page>.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

returnValues.description: Seconds of game uptime as an integer.

functions.name: BatteryPower
functions.description: Returns the current battery power.

returnValues.description:
0-100 if on battery power.

If plugged in, the value will be 255 regardless of charging state.

functions.name: FlashWindow
functions.description: Flashes the window, turning the border to white briefly

functions.name: GetCountry
functions.description:
Returns the country code of this computer, determined by the localisation settings of the OS.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

functions.name: HasFocus
functions.description:
Returns whether or not the game window has focus.

Returns true 100% of the time on OS X.

<note>This function does not work on dedicated servers and will instead return no value.</note>

<bug issue="2424">This will return true when minimized in windowed-mode.</bug>

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game window has focus.

functions.name: IsLinux
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is Linux.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game is running on Linux.

functions.name: IsOSX
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is OSX.

returnValues.description: Whether or not the game is running on OSX.

functions.name: IsWindowed
functions.description: Returns whether the game is being run in a window or in fullscreen (you can change this by opening the menu, clicking 'Options', then clicking the 'Video' tab, and changing the Display Mode using the dropdown menu):

returnValues.description: Is the game running in a window?

functions.name: IsWindows
functions.description: Returns whether the current OS is Windows.

returnValues.description: Whether the system the game runs on is Windows or not.

functions.name: SteamTime
functions.description:
Returns the synchronized Steam time. This is the number of seconds since the [Unix epoch](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time).

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

functions.name: UpTime
functions.description:
Returns the amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

This is a direct binding to ISteamUtils->GetSecondsSinceComputerActive, and is most likely related to Steam's automatic "Away" online status.

<note>This function does not work on Dedicated Servers and will instead return no value.</note>

returnValues.description: The amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

name: table
description:
The table `type` is an object that can store multiple values.

The table `library` is a standard Lua library which provides functions to manipulate tables. In Garry's Mod there are several extra useful functions added to this library.

This category lists the functions available in the table `library`.

functions.name: Add
functions.description:
Adds the contents from one table into another. The target table will be modified.

See also <page>table.Inherit</page> and <page>table.Merge</page>.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The table to insert the new values into.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The table to retrieve the values from.

functions.name: ClearKeys
functions.description: Changes all keys to sequential integers. This creates a new table object and does not affect the original.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The original table to modify.

arguments.name: saveKeys
arguments.description: Save the keys within each member table. This will insert a new field `__key` into each value, and should not be used if the table contains non-table values.

functions.name: CollapseKeyValue
functions.description: Collapses a table with keyvalue structure

arguments.name: input
arguments.description: Input table

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenates the contents of a table to a string.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to concatenate.

arguments.name: concatenator
arguments.description: A seperator to insert between strings

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The key to start at

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The key to end at

functions.name: Copy
functions.description:
Creates a deep copy and returns that copy.

<warning>This function does NOT copy userdata, such as <page>Vector</page>s and <page>Angle</page>s!</warning>

arguments.name: originalTable
arguments.description: The table to be copied.

returnValues.description: A deep copy of the original table

functions.name: CopyFromTo
functions.description: Empties the target table, and merges all values from the source table into it.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The table to copy from.

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The table to write to.

functions.name: Count
functions.description:
Counts the amount of keys in a table. This should only be used when a table is not numerically and sequentially indexed. For those tables, consider the length (**#**) operator.

If you only want to test if the table is empty or not, use <page>table.IsEmpty</page> instead as it is a lot faster.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to count the keys of.

returnValues.description: The number of keyvalue pairs. This includes non-numeric and non-sequential keys, unlike the length (**#**) operator.

functions.name: DeSanitise
functions.description: Converts a table that has been sanitised with <page>table.Sanitise</page> back to its original form

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to be de-sanitised

functions.name: Empty
functions.description: Removes all values from a table.

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: The table to empty.

functions.name: FindNext
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, iterate the table using ipairs or increment from the previous index using <page>Global.next</page>. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.</deprecated>
Returns the value positioned after the supplied value in a table. If it isn't found then the first element in the table is returned

arguments.name: tbl
arguments.description: Table to search

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to return element after

functions.name: FindPrev
functions.description:
<deprecated>Instead, iterate your table with ipairs, storing the previous value and checking for the target. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.</deprecated>

functions.name: foreach
functions.description:
<deprecated>This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use <page>Global.pairs</page>() instead.</deprecated> Iterates for each key-value pair in the table, calling the function with the key and value of the pair. If the function returns anything, the loop is broken.

This is inherited from the original Lua implementation and is deprecated in Lua as of 5.1; see [here](http://lua-users.org/wiki/TableLibraryTutorial). You should use <page>Global.pairs</page>() instead. The GLua interpretation of this is <page>table.ForEach</page>.

arguments.name: tbl

<deprecated>This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use <page>Global.ipairs</page>() instead.</deprecated> Iterates for each numeric index in the table in order.

This is inherited from the original Lua implementation and is deprecated in Lua as of 5.1; see [here](http://lua-users.org/wiki/TableLibraryTutorial). You should use <page>Global.ipairs</page>() instead.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The table to iterate over.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to run for each index.

functions.name: HasValue
functions.description:
Checks if a table has a value.
<warning>This function is **very inefficient for large tables** (O(n)) and should probably not be called in things that run each frame. Instead, consider a table structure such as example 2 below.</warning>
<note>For optimization, functions that look for a value by sorting the table should never be needed if you work on a table that you built yourself.</note>

arguments.name: tbl

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Value to search for

returnValues.description: Returns true if the table has that value, false otherwise

functions.name: Inherit
functions.description:
Copies any missing data from base to target, and sets the target's `BaseClass` member to the base table's pointer.

See <page>table.Merge</page>, which overrides existing values and doesn't add a BaseClass member.


See also <page>table.Add</page>, which simply adds values of one table to another.

<bug pull="1304">Sub-tables aren't inherited. The target's table value will take priority.</bug>

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: Table to copy data to

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Table to copy data from

Returns a random value from the supplied table.

```

```
</warning>

name: timer
description: The timer library is a very useful set of functions which allow you to run a function periodically or after a given delay.

functions.name: Adjust
functions.description: Adjusts the timer if the timer with the given identifier exists.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to adjust.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay interval in seconds.

arguments.name: repetitions
arguments.description: Repetitions. Use 0 for infinite.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The new function.

functions.name: Check
functions.description: <deprecated></deprecated> This function does nothing.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
Creates a new timer that will repeat its function given amount of times.
This function also requires the timer to be named, which allows you to control it after it was created via the <page>timer</page>.

For a simple one-time timer with no identifiers, see <page>timer.Simple</page>.

<warning>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless sv_hibernate_think is set to 1)</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to create. Must be unique. If a timer already exists with the same identifier, that timer will be updated to the new settings and reset.

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: The delay interval in seconds. If the delay is too small, the timer will fire on the next frame/tick.

arguments.name: repetitions
arguments.description: The number of times to repeat the timer. Enter 0 for infinite repetitions.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: Function called when timer has finished the countdown.

functions.name: Destroy
functions.description: <deprecated>You should be using <page>timer.Remove</page> instead.</deprecated> Stops and destroys the given timer. Alias of <page>timer.Remove</page>.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to destroy.

functions.name: Exists
functions.description: Returns whenever the given timer exists or not.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: Returns true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't

functions.name: Pause
functions.description: Pauses the given timer.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already paused, true otherwise.

functions.name: Remove
functions.description:
Stops and removes a timer created by <page>timer.Create</page>.
<warning>The timers are removed in the next frame! Keep this in mind when storing identifiers in variables.</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer to remove.

functions.name: RepsLeft
functions.description: Returns amount of repetitions/executions left before the timer destroys itself.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

functions.name: Simple
functions.description:
Creates a simple timer that runs the given function after a specified delay.

For a more advanced version that you can control after creation, see <page>timer.Create</page>.

<warning>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> internally. Due to this, they won't advance while the client is timing out from the server or on an empty dedicated server due to hibernation. (unless sv_hibernate_think is set to 1)</warning>

arguments.name: delay
arguments.description: How long until the function should be ran (in seconds). Use 0 to have the function run in the next <page>GM:Think</page>.

arguments.name: func
arguments.description: The function to run after the specified delay.

functions.name: Start
functions.description:
Restarts the given timer.

<note>Timers use <page>Global.CurTime</page> for timing.</note>
<warning>Timers won't advance while the client is timing out from the server.</warning>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: true if the timer exists, false if it doesn't.

functions.name: Stop
functions.description: Stops the given timer and rewinds it.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already stopped, true otherwise.

functions.name: TimeLeft
functions.description:
Returns amount of time left (in seconds) before the timer executes its function.

<note>If the timer is paused, the amount will be negative.</note>

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: The amount of time left (in seconds).

functions.name: Toggle
functions.description: Runs either <page>timer.Pause</page> or <page>timer.UnPause</page> based on the timer's current status.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

functions.name: UnPause
functions.description: Unpauses the timer.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: Identifier of the timer.

returnValues.description: false if the timer didn't exist or was already running, true otherwise.

name: utf8
description:
The utf8 library provides basic support for UTF-8 encoding. This library does not provide any support for Unicode other than the handling of the encoding. Any operation that needs the meaning of a character, such as character classification, is outside its scope.

Unless stated otherwise, all functions that expect a byte position as a parameter assume that the given position is either the start of a byte sequence or one plus the length of the subject string. As in the string library, negative indices count from the end of the string.

functions.name: char
functions.description: Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

arguments.name: codepoints
arguments.description: Unicode code points to be converted in to a UTF-8 string.

returnValues.description: UTF-8 string generated from given arguments.

functions.name: codepoint
functions.description: Returns the codepoints (as numbers) from all characters in the given string that start between byte position startPos and endPos. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence. This functions similarly to <page>string.byte</page>.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the code(s) from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The starting byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The ending byte of the string to get the codepoint of.

functions.name: codes
functions.description: Returns an iterator (like <page>string.gmatch</page>) which returns both the position and codepoint of each utf8 character in the string. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the codes from.

returnValues.description: The iterator (to be used in a for loop).

functions.name: force
functions.description:
Forces a string to contain only valid UTF-8 data. Invalid sequences are replaced with U+FFFD (the Unicode replacement character).

This is a lazy way for users to ensure a string contains only valid UTF-8 data.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that will become a valid UTF-8 string.

functions.name: len
functions.description: Returns the number of UTF-8 sequences in the given string between positions startPos and endPos (both inclusive). If it finds any invalid UTF-8 byte sequence, returns false as well as the position of the first invalid byte.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string to calculate the length of.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The starting position to get the length from.

arguments.name: endPos
arguments.description: The ending position to get the length from.

returnValues.description: The number of UTF-8 characters in the string. If there are invalid bytes, this will be false.
The position of the first invalid byte. If there were no invalid bytes, this will be nil.

functions.name: offset
functions.description: Returns the byte-index of the n'th UTF-8-character after the given startPos (nil if none). startPos defaults to 1 when n is positive and -1 when n is negative. If n is zero, this function instead returns the byte-index of the UTF-8-character startPos lies within.

arguments.name: string
arguments.description: The string that you will get the byte position from.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: The position to get the beginning byte position from.

arguments.name: startPos
arguments.description: The offset for n.

returnValues.description: Starting byte-index of the given position.

name: util
description: This is the list of utility functions.

functions.name: AddNetworkString
functions.description:
Adds the specified string to a string table, which will cache it and network it to all clients automatically.
Whenever you want to create a net message with net.Start, you must add the name of that message as a networked string via this function. If the passed string already exists, nothing will happen and the ID of the existing item will be returned. Each unique network name needs to be pooled once - do not put this function call into any other functions if you're using a constant string. Preferable place for this function is in a serverside lua file, or in a shared file with the net.Receive function. The string table used for this function does not interfere with the engine string tables and has 2048 slots.

arguments.name: str
arguments.description: Adds the specified string to the string table.

returnValues.description:
The id of the string that was added to the string table.
Same as calling util.NetworkStringToID.

functions.name: Effect
functions.description:
Creates an effect with the specified data.

You can find a list of built-in engine effects <page text="here">Effects</page>. You can create your own. Example effects can be found [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/sandbox/entities/effects) and [here](https://github.com/garrynewman/garrysmod/tree/master/garrysmod/gamemodes/base/entities/effects).

<note>When dispatching an effect from the server, some values may be clamped for networking optimizations. Visit the Set accessors on <page>CEffectData</page> to see which ones are affected.</note>
<note>You will need to couple this function with <page>Global.IsFirstTimePredicted</page> if you want to use it in <page text="predicted hook">Prediction</page>.</note>

arguments.name: effectName
arguments.description: The name of the effect to create.

arguments.name: effectData
arguments.description: The effect data describing the effect.

arguments.name: allowOverride
arguments.description: Whether Lua-defined effects should override engine-defined effects with the same name for this/single function call.

arguments.name: ignorePredictionOrRecipientFilter
arguments.description:
Can either be a boolean to ignore the prediction filter or a <page>CRecipientFilter</page>.

Set this to true if you wish to call this function in multiplayer from server.

functions.name: GetModelInfo
functions.description:
Returns a table containing the info about the model.

<note>This function will silently fail if used on models with following strings in them:
* _shared
* _anims
* _gestures
* _anim
* _postures
* _gst
* _pst
* _shd
* _ss
* _anm
* _include</note>

arguments.name: mdl
arguments.description: Model path

returnValues.description:
The model info as a table with the following keys:
* <page>number</page> SkinCount - Identical to <page>Entity:SkinCount</page>.
* <page>string</page> KeyValues - Valve key-value formatted info about the model's physics (Constraint Info, etc). This is limited to 4096 characters.
* <page>string</page> ModelKeyValues - Valve key-value formatted info about the model ($keyvalues command in the .qc of the model), if present

functions.name: GetModelMeshes
functions.description:
Returns a table of visual meshes of given model.

<note>This does not work on brush models (`*number` models)</note>

See also <page>ENTITY:GetRenderMesh</page>.

arguments.name: model
arguments.description: The full path to a model to get the visual meshes of.

returnValues.description:
A table of tables with the following format:
* <page>string</page> material - The material of the specific mesh
* <page>table</page> triangles - A table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>es ready to be fed into <page>IMesh:BuildFromTriangles</page>
* <page>table</page> verticies - A table of <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page>es representing all the vertexes of the mesh. This table is used internally to generate the "triangles" table.

Each <page>Structures/MeshVertex</page> returned also has an extra table of tables field called "weights" with the following data:
* <page>number</page> boneID - The bone this vertex is attached to
* <page>number</page> weight - How "strong" this vertex is attached to the bone. A vertex can be attached to multiple bones at once.

functions.name: IntersectRayWithOBB
functions.description: Performs a "ray" box intersection and returns position, normal and the fraction.

arguments.name: rayStart
arguments.description: Origin/start position of the ray.

arguments.name: rayDelta
arguments.description:
The ray vector itself. This can be thought of as: the ray end point relative to the start point.

Note that in this implementation, the ray is not infinite - it's only a segment.

arguments.name: boxOrigin
arguments.description: The center of the box.

arguments.name: boxAngles
arguments.description: The angles of the box.

arguments.name: boxMins
arguments.description: The min position of the box.

arguments.name: boxMaxs
arguments.description: The max position of the box.

returnValues.description: Hit position, nil if not hit.
Normal/direction vector, nil if not hit.
Fraction of trace used, nil if not hit.

functions.name: IsValidModel
functions.description:
Checks if the specified model is valid.

A model is considered invalid in following cases:
* Starts with a space or **maps**
* Doesn't start with **models**
* Contains any of the following:
* * _gestures
* * _animations
* * _postures
* * _gst
* * _pst
* * _shd
* * _ss
* * _anm
* * .bsp
* * cs_fix
* On server: If the model isn't precached, if the model file doesn't exist on the disk
* If precache failed
* Model is the error model

arguments.name: modelName
arguments.description: Name/Path of the model to check.

returnValues.description: Whether the model is valid or not. Returns false clientside if the model is not precached by the server.

<bug issue="2407">Colors will not have the color metatable.</bug>

arguments.description:
Function to call after an entity choice has been made. Argument is:
<page>table</page> tr - <page>TraceResult from the mouse press. tr.Entity will return the entity clicked</page>

name: vgui
description:
The vgui library allows you to script and create your own panels using Valve's GUI system.
For an alphabetically ordered list of VGUI panels, see VGUI Element List.

functions.name: Create
functions.description:
Creates a panel by the specified classname.
<note>Custom VGUI elements are not loaded instantly. Use <page>GM:OnGamemodeLoaded</page> to create them on startup.</note>

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Classname of the panel to create. Valid classnames are listed at: <page>VGUI Element List</page>.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: Parent of the created panel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the created panel.

functions.name: CreateFromTable
functions.description: Creates a panel from table.

arguments.name: metatable
arguments.description: Your PANEL table

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: Which panel to parent the newly created panel to

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of your panel

functions.name: CreateX
functions.description: <internal></internal> Creates a engine panel.

arguments.name: class
arguments.description: Class of the panel to create

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: If specified, parents created panel to given one

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the created panel

functions.name: CursorVisible
functions.description: Returns whenever the cursor is currently active and visible.

functions.name: FocusedHasParent
functions.description: Returns whether the currently focused panel is a child of the given one.

arguments.name: parent
arguments.description: The parent panel to check the currently focused one against. This doesn't need to be a direct parent (focused panel can be a child of a child and so on).

returnValues.description: Whether or not the focused panel is a child of the passed one.

functions.name: GetControlTable
functions.description: Gets the method table of this panel. Does not return parent methods!

arguments.name: Panelname
arguments.description: The name of the panel

functions.name: GetHoveredPanel
functions.description:
Returns the panel the cursor is hovering above.

<warning>This returns a cached value that is only updated after rendering and `before` the next VGUI Think/Layout pass.

ie. it lags one frame behind panel layout and is completely unhelpful for <page>PANEL:Paint</page> if your panels are moving around under the mouse a lot every frame.</warning>

returnValues.description: The panel that the user is currently hovering over with their cursor.

functions.name: GetKeyboardFocus
functions.description: Returns the panel which is currently receiving keyboard input.

functions.name: GetWorldPanel
functions.description:
Returns the global world panel which is the parent to all others.

See also <page>Global.GetHUDPanel</page>.

functions.name: IsHoveringWorld
functions.description: Returns whenever the cursor is hovering the world panel.

functions.name: Register
functions.description: Registers a panel for later creation.

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Classname of the panel to create.

arguments.name: panelTable
arguments.description: The table containg the panel information.

arguments.name: baseName
arguments.description: Name of the base of the panel.

returnValues.description: The given panel table from second argument

functions.name: RegisterFile
functions.description: Registers a new VGUI panel from a file.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: The file to register

returnValues.description: A table containing info about the panel. Can be supplied to <page>vgui.CreateFromTable</page>

functions.name: RegisterTable
functions.description: Registers a table to use as a panel. All this function does is assigns Base key to your table and returns the table.

arguments.name: panel
arguments.description: The PANEL table

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: A base for the panel

name: video
description: The video library.

functions.name: Record
functions.description: Attempts to create an <page>IVideoWriter</page>.

arguments.name: config
arguments.description: The video config. See <page>Structures/VideoData</page>.

returnValues.description: The video object (returns **false** if there is an error)
The error string, if there is an error

name: weapons
description: The weapons library allows you to access information about any scripted weapons loaded into the game, as well as register your own weapons.

functions.name: Get
functions.description: Get a `copy` of weapon table by name. This function also inherits fields from the weapon's base class, unlike <page>weapons.GetStored</page>.

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Class name of weapon to retrieve

functions.name: GetList
functions.description: Get a list of all the registered SWEPs. This does not include weapons added to spawnmenu manually.

returnValues.description: List of all the registered SWEPs

functions.name: GetStored
functions.description:
Gets the REAL weapon table, not a copy. The produced table does `not` inherit fields from the weapon's base class, unlike <page>weapons.Get</page>.

<warning>Modifying this table will modify what is stored by the weapons library. Take a copy or use <page>weapons.Get</page> to avoid this.</warning>

arguments.name: weapon_class
arguments.description: Weapon class to retrieve weapon table of

functions.name: IsBasedOn
functions.description: Checks if name is based on base

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Entity's class name to be checked

arguments.name: base
arguments.description: Base class name to be checked

returnValues.description: Returns true if class name is based on base, else false.

functions.name: OnLoaded
functions.description:
<internal></internal>

Called after all SWEPS have been loaded and runs <page>baseclass.Set</page> on each one.

You can retrieve all the currently registered SWEPS with <page>weapons.GetList</page>.

<note>This is not called after a SWEP auto refresh, and thus the inherited baseclass functions retrieved with <page>baseclass.Get</page> will not be updated</note>

functions.name: Register
functions.description:
Used to register your SWEP with the engine.

<bug pull="1300">Sub-tables provided in the first argument will not carry over their metatable, and will receive a BaseClass key if the table was merged with the base's. Userdata references, which includes Vectors, Angles, Entities, etc. will not be copied.</bug>

arguments.name: swep_table
arguments.description: The SWEP table

arguments.name: classname
arguments.description: Classname to assign to that swep

name: widgets
description:
The widgets library.

Widgets allow the player to have mouse interaction with entities, such as being able to manipulate the [bones of an NPC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3gG0t39-pQ).

functions.name: PlayerTick
functions.description: <internal></internal> Automatically called to update all widgets.

arguments.name: ply
arguments.description: The player

arguments.name: mv
arguments.description: Player move data

functions.name: RenderMe
functions.description: Renders a widget. Normally you won't need to call this.

arguments.name: ent
arguments.description: Widget entity to render
